text: Plum and raisins on the nose. Finish is more on the dry, subtle side than bombast Belgian. Good carbonation, but to me (Im a rube) taste could be a bit more in the foreground. Could grow on me, seems similar perhaps to Orval in its subtlety
Piwo wypite jakiś czas temu. Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji, w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.

330m bottle. As Corsendonk Pater Dubbel Ale. (6.5% ABV) Pours a hazy ruby-brown with a large, frothy, long lasting, beige head that leaves curtains of lace. Yeasty aroma with dark fruit, spices and caramel malt. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, dark fruit, red wine, dark chocolate, spices and yeast with a dry, slightly bitter finish. Medium body with an oily texture and average carbonation. Pretty decent.

Bottle from tesco. Sweet caramel, honey, plum aroma. Dark colour with red tones, big creamy head. Taste of caramel, honey, little bit roasty, black fruit and lovely earthy bitter finish. Really enjoyed this piece.
Greetings from Bydgoszcz, Poland to all Beer Geeks and Hopheads around the world!

Dark brown/ruby red with a frothy three-finger tan head and thick lacing. Aromas of caramel, bread, dark fruit, banana and a hint of coffee. Bready and dark fruit sweetness accompanied by earthy hops, yeast and modest peppery spice. Medium body, well-carbonated, bubbly mouthfeel and a rich finish.

Bottle. 6.5% ABV. Dark red brown black color. Thin persistent brown head. Aroma is fruity, nutty, liquorice, spices. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter. Medium body. Flavour is caramel, roasted, smooth coffee, pineapple.

Butelka 330 ml . Ciemnobrazowa barwa. Pianalekko palona,obfita o duzych pecherzach opada dosc szybko. W aromacie palone alody karmel lekkie drozdze w tle. W smaku karmel toffi palone slody lekki chlebowy posmak . Ogolnie dosc slodkawe z miodowo-chlebowa nuta. Smakuje . Moje oznaczone jako 6,5%.
Very dark brown beer, tastes of burnt toffee, caramel. Light carbonation, Awesome.

Bottle from Lidl - 4 for a fiver (ish). This one were 6,5%, but deffo labelled as Pater. Ok Bruin, maybe an average Dubbel actually. The taste is ok, but it was way too fizzy. Each normal sized gobful, resulted in a rancorous belch. Not too sociable. Better than breaking wind though. This is probably a good beer. Might open another and let it go flat for a bit before necking.
DWF mørk med mørk hvit skum som henger. Aroma gjær sjokolade malt. Smak søt fruktig malt rosiner. Veldig god

Aroma of banana and dried fruits. Pours a thick brown with a medium to large tan head. Extremely moorish taste of fruit and spice, slightly sweet. Finish is creamy, spicy and lip smacking. Phenomenal.

Dark brown color. Medium to high carbonation. Aroma had a touch of barnyard funk, some caramel, spices. Low sweetness, touch of roast, nutty and spicy flavor, noticeable hops, much more than normal for the style, strong boozy finish. Overall very balanced. Was very good, but lacked the complexity of its brothers, yet, it wasnt so obsenly phenolic, so I think it is a good starter dubbel.

Bottle, 0.33l. 6.5% ABV. Deep amber pour with one finger creamy off-white head. Average head retention, good lacing. Strong nose, sugary sweet with intense caramel, slightly herbal.

Medium body, slightly aggressive carbonation. Average texture, somewhat light palate. Bittersweet taste. Aroma is herbal liquor, slight honey, very subtle cocoa. Brown sugar, not aggressive. Quite pronounced caramel presence, toffee, alcohol. Flowery, herbal. Slight mint in the aftertaste. Dry finish with notable alcohol presence.

Overall, tasty dubbel. Quality brew.

Nez : Café. Couleur : noir, mousse dense onctueuse. Texture douce et soyeuse. Légère carbonation Gout : Légère et furtive acidité en entré sur le bout de la langue, un peu dépices, puis viens une amertume qui monte crescendo, notes de café, caramel et malts grillés.
Accords : Dégusté avec un petit basque. Le gras du fromage se mari parfaitement a la sécheresse de cette Corsendonk. Le fromage manquais juste un peu de puissance.

Bottled. Pours deep brown with off-white head. Roasted malts, coffee and some other notes that make its aroma brown ale-ish. Sweet taste with the samr notes and very flat carbonation. Light bodied, easily drinkable.

Bière brune, limite rubis, très mousseuse, une odeur de fruits rouges, un peu dacidité dans larôme. Elle est assez pétillante, un peu astringente, un goût métallique, pas trop damertume, ce goût ferreux reste en fin de bouche. Bière pas mauvaise mais pas transcendantale, elle sort de lordinaire mais je ne recommande pas

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Cola brown. Almost no head. Sweet malts, minimal sour yeast. Bergamot, lemon, sugary bread, doughy sticky mouthfeel. Not getting any kind of fruity chocolatey notes like others mentioned. Not so great, but decent.
Dark amber colour. Malty notes and grape/rooibos flavours. Lively and keeps its head. Lovely beer

Espuma de via formação e baixa duração 
Coloração marrom escuro
Nota de madeira e ameixa

330 ml bottle. Hazy dark brown in the glass, ruby around the edges, off-white head. Sweet malty aroma of dried fruit, dried plum, faint toast. Taste is complex malt, dried fruit, red fruit, dried plum, raisins. Moderately sweet, rather low bitterness. Medium to full body, moderately thick texture, average carbonation.

Aroma of acedelythate with notes of dark fruit and faint roastiness of the malts. Dark brown in the glass with frothy head. Taste of fruit, especially dark and red with tartness of vinegar. Bit of coffee cherries in the background. Good, but Ive expected more.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Duft sød karamel rugbrød smag sød rugbrød malt karamel malt sød lidt citrus humle smag
Bottle. Pours dark brown with reddish notes. Smells and tastes of malts, plums, a bit of coffee. Very good and would gladly have again.
Het bier is bruin met een rode gloed. Een bruine schuimkraag. Het heeft een lekkere geroosterde nasmaak.

Pour deep brown with some red hues. 3 finger off white head that sticks to the glass with nice lacing. Aroma is candy sugar, plum fruits, malts, coffee and chocolate. Flavor was most of the same. Medium body and carbonation for the style. Pretty good stuff from Corsendonk

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 Mörkröd med tjockt beige skumkrona. Luktar fruktigt, lite pepprigt och bränd farinsocker. Smaken hyggligt fyllig, lite åt svagdricka. Eftersmaken ganska tunn, lite maltsötma. Ganska mkt kolsyra som dock försvinner snabbt.

Aroma floral y afrutado.

En boca el primer amago es un intento por salir a relucir el caramelo, frutos negros y especias, pero pronto la acidez y el café torrefacto se apoderan del conjunto. A mí personalmente me agrada mucho más una Dubbel más caramelizada y amable.

Bottle from Lidl, Carrick-on-Shannon [110916]
Ruby brown, clear, big frothy beige head
Aroma of rich sweet fruity brown caramel malts, red fruits, soft fruity yeast esters, port wine, complex malts
Taste of complex brown malts, caramel, red fruits, port, vinous, mellow, very light hops, dab of spice, its all about the malts, yum yum
Palate - Medium carb and body, quite sweet, rich malts, smooth. Finish of rich brown malts
Overall - Malty, soft belgian yeast, more spicy with the drinking. Its best drunk at room temperature
Den smager af jul. Meget mørk og med tæt skum. Der er lidt lakrids at spore, malt og ikke den vamle sødme der tit ødelægger julebryg.
Bottle. Brown with medium beige head. Aromas of brown sugar, malts and some toffee. Taste is mild, sugar and some sweet bread. Watery texture. Fine ale.
From a 33 cl bottle. Pours a hazy mahogany with a thick tan head. Aroma of toffee and caramel. Flavors same. Lively carbonation. Smooth finish.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 26B). Bottle 33 cl - Batch B 14:27 AROMA: predominant toasty malt aroma with a faint raisin note. slight peppery alcohol note. APPEARANCE: dark amber color with ruby body against light. Large off-white head with medium retention. Lace formation. TASTE: medium-low toasty, almost caramelly malty-sweet note. faint plum notes. medium-low bitterness with a malty balance. Finishes almost dry and slightly bitter. PALATE: medium-low body with medium-high carbonation. slight alcohol warmth. Smooth. OVERALL: a Belgian Dubbel not very much complex and with more muted flavor.
Bottle. Color: Very dark chestnut brown. Light brown head. Taste: Roasted malts, yeast, hints of nuts and chocolate.

Originally rated on 12/5/08. A little disappointed in this one, the aroma and flavors were barely present however there were very, very faint hints and tastes of raisin, and malts but not much else. It looked nice with a very deep brown body, plenty of carbonation and a good head. Mouthfeel was smooth and the alcohol was well hidden. I liked this beer overall but the flavors should have been more assertive for such a highly rated brew. I would like to give it a second chance someday.

Pours chestnut brown from the bottle. Aroma is cherry soda and lightly yeasty. Taste has a dry sweetness, strong fruit notes ( mostly cherry) and a hint of caramel. Body remains on the light side. Decent stuff.

Brązowe piwo o obfitej pianie, która zdobi szkło i redukuje się do warstewki na powierzchni. Aromat ciemnych owoców, głownie rodzynki. W smaku lekko kwaskowe, trochę owocowe, trochę ciemnych słodów. Goryczka średnia. Ogólnie bardzo udany dubel, typowy dla stylu, pijalny.

Pours golden color, clear, almost brilliant, with long lasting, very stable white creamy head (actually was untouched till last ship). Visually high carbonation. Aroma: muscat grape, some spices, florals...peaches, apples...flavor: bread, toffee like malt flavor, with spicy, floral, slightly citrusy notes of hops and grape like esters. Finish is very dry, slightly bitter, which lasting in aftertaste. Body is light to medium, texture soft, carbonation is medium.
UPDATED: JUN 13, 2017 Owoce, rodzynki, biszkopty, nuty przyprawowe, orzechy, słodka czekolada. Średnie ciało, goryczka średnia do niskiej, wysokie wysycenie.
Bottle. Brown chestnut color, hazy liquid, not much of a head. Banana smell. Aroma of alcohol, banana, liquor, honey, malt. Good, but alcohol is too dominant in this one.
UPDATED: FEB 24, 2017 W aromacie i smaku dominacja zbożowości i słodowości, nieco estrów. Ładne w wyglądzie - brązowe z solidną beżową pianą. Lekkie, przyjemne, smaczne piwo.

Dark brown pour with slight brown top. No lacing. Aromas of sweet malt and slight astringency. Flavor is somewhat watery, but pleasant. Lots of malt and some hop balance. Finish is similar. Very drinkable.

33cl bb10/2018. - Named after an Augustine Abbey closed after the French Revolution, since 1906 contract brewed in "hommage" by defunct Keersmaekers in Oud-Turnhout who have now acquired a 100% in Du Bocq...and not a trace of any of them on the label. Bienvenue en Belgique. Ergo: "Corsendonk", like Leffe, is a beer firm and swindle label, reaching from the faux-abbey purist bottle design to the tight-lipped info about ingredients used ("contains barley malt"). - Pours a brackish brown plum juice with macro yeast eyes. Aroma very reticent, especially at the proposed serving temp of 4-6 C. Maybe some banana and plum, instant fruit sugars. Taste is basically old prune juice with two lumps of cassonade Graeffe, carbonation tongue numbingly high, brownish hop bitterness late, basic and bananapeel-metallic. The candi/y sugar in the frontal lobes of the skull starts to build after the 2nd sip... Like drinking sugary banana&plum bubble gum. Soulless brew. Why is this cheap 80s-style atrocity a TOP 50 Abbey Dubbel? #AnachronisticBelgianWorldExports #LiquidHeadache #AllMaltSharia4BelgianContractBrewers

Pours with a three finger, khaki head that leaves a little lace. Opaque brown color. Good carbonation and medium bodied. Light roasted malt nose. Flavor follows, a hint of soapy bitterness at finish. $4.80 for a 330ml bottle from Colonial Spirits Acton, Ma.
750 ml bottle pours a dark brown color with a nice tan head. Aromas of dark fruits, yeast, candied sugar. Full bodied, rich, complex, delicious.

Kolor: rubinowy, zamglony. 
Piana: bardzo obfita, strzelająca, dziurawi się i szybko opada.
Zapach: ciemne suszone owoce, daktyle, śliwki, rodzynki, lekkie aromaty słodowe, miodowe, karmelowe.
Smak: dość smukłe, lekka pełnia, tak jak w aromacie nuty ciemnych suszonych owoców, karmel, trochę nut opiekanych, melanoidynowych, goryczka średnia w kierunku niskiej.
Wysycenie: wysokie.
Cerveja escura muito equilibrada. Ideal com raiz fortes e culinaria alema. Embalagem linda.

Habja olyan mint az agnusé, csak szép capucchino színű. Színe egészen fekete. Illata nem olyan intenzív, viszont megjelenik egy kis karamelles vonás. Íze enyhén pörkölt, gyümölcsös beütéssel. Semmi keserűsség. Közepes testű sör.
Nice strong black pepper aroma though it dominates a bit over the other notes of dried fruit. Sweet taste of prunes and some roasted malt flavor. Not much bitterness. Good tasting belgian.
Corsendonk Pater dubbel ale , бутылка 0,33. Крепост& 6,5. Немного разочар& Питкий, но невыраз& дуббель.

Belgijskie piwo klasztorne. Solidny Dubbel. Przyjemny aromat, wyrazisty smak. Godne polecenia.

Belgian beer monastery. Robust Dubbel. Pleasant aroma, distinct taste. Worth recommending.
UPDATED: JUN 12, 2016 De cor marrom palido e espuma abundante. Delicada, com notas de ameixa e maltes queimados. Amargor aparece depois e permanece.

Tap at Jacs, but this might have been the first Belgian beer I ever had in bottle form decades ago. Deep unfiltered brown, hints of burgundy. Foamy, beige head. A touch of dry aspirin, but more deep, dark fruit. Brown malt tones. Big yeast tones, otherwise a creamy big brown ale. Quite an excellent, classic example of a Belgian Brown. Almost medium bodied in the world of Belgian Ale. Caramel, molasses, brown sugar. Excellent.

Got this served straight from the draft. Dark brown beer, hints of red fruit and caramel. Sweet taste, but not too sweet like some of other dark beers.

Pretty good beer, though id rather drink this in winter than summer.
UPDATED: MAY 27, 2016 Dark brown/black body, minimal tan head. Sour aroma, dried fruit, hints of caramel. Sweet caramel taste, some chocolate and fruity notes. Medium body, average carbonation. Fine.
Bottled in LA Guardia airport, celebratory drink after a presentation. Tastes good.
0,33l bottle, Känguruh Vienna. Mild malty, sweet aroma. Dark brown/black color with rich white head. Sweet, caramel, nougat taste with a sweet end.
Bottle 0,33l. Dark mahogany color. Smell of red fruits. Taste is a bit sour, dry, cloves, caramel. Medium body and carbonation. Tart fruits taste.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Look: dark brown, hazy, beige head with average retention.

Aroma: roasted, dark berries, light spicy notes.
Taste: moderate caramel sweetness with prominent berry sourness.
Light body with moderate to strong carbonation.
Flavour: roasted, chocolate desert with berries.

Not bad.
Bottle. Brown color with beige head. Aroma is spicy, dark malts, caramel, some prunes. Taste is spicy, candied sugar. High carbonation. Not really my type of beer. Meh.
Mine is 6.5 ABV and has Pater Dubbel Ale on bottle. Its a decent Belgian ale. Not sure I would purchase again...there nothing that really makes it stand out.

Bottle at home 6.5%. Very dark brown with light bitten head and lots of lacing. Raisins, figs, some milk chocolate, old fruit skins, dried out red wine, a bit dusty, old coffee dregs. Quite a lot of old notes mixed with dried fruits and sugary aromas. Under medium sweet and light bitter. Medium bodied with a bit slick feel and soft carbonation.
Mörkbrun ale med stabilt gräddigt vitt skum. Lätt arom av malt och torkad frukt. Lätt sötma och toner av dadel, fikon i smak. God, lite starkare belgisk brown ale men lite tunn smak.

clear pitchblack, giant off-white head, spicy malty aroma, some alkohol, thin mouthfeel, fizzy carbonation, quite spicy, muscat, clove, pepper, malty sweetness, toasted flavours, some hoppy bitterness

Bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown with a moderately lasting beige head. Aroma is of nuts, caramel, treacle, chocolate, figs. Taste is of treacle, bread, brown sugar, nuts, dark fruits, cola notes. Light bubbly oily mouthfeel, medium to hard carbonation.
2016/04/11 thuis. Fantastisch presenterend bier. Nijgt naar een dropsmaak. Heerlijk donker bier, smaakt super.

Hazy copper color, tall tan head. 
Intense rusty nose. 
Full body, bright mouthfeel, moderate but adequately strong flavor, heat and carbonation, great balance, lingering palate with a delucious finish. 
Moderately sweet, enough bitterness and acidity to reach a perfect balance. 
Roasty, coffee, malty, yeasty, creme brulé, earthy. 
Considering that the sample I tasted was 4 years beyond its Drink By date, its an exceptional beer. Very easy drinking. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours is dark brown with big tan head, fair lacing. Aroma is malty, dried fruits, plums, cinammon, spices. Taste is light sweet, moderate bitter with some acidic notes, malty mouthfeel. Medium body, sticky texture, malty aftertaste.
Dark amber withn off white head - Malt in the aorma - Dark malt body with some spicy fruity tones - The dark malts goes into the finish - This was good

Aroma: caramel, toast, gentle roasty, toffee, dough, very gentle herbs, some esters (surprising), raisins. Interesting, well balanced.
brown, hazy, white foam, good retention.
light sweetness, lightly bitter, raisins, roast, caramel, toffee, again some esters. Well balanced, but expected more depth. 
medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, short sweetish finish. 
Overall nicely balanced and quite pleasant, but could use a little less sweetness and more depth.

6,5% ABV bottle from Drinkshop. Clear very dark brown colour, quickly disappearing head. Aroma fruity, figues, cola, dried fruits. Taste is moderately sweet, light to moderate bitterness. Mostly fruity in flavour, dried fruits, figues. Also colaish. Quite good. High carbonation, moderately drinkable.
Flaska från Beergium. Gravöl med kusin Mattias. Mörkbrun med beiget skum. Lite smörig popcorn-doft som känns typiskt för belgisk klosteröl. Torr, lätt söt och något brända toner. Känns rätt medioker.
Bottle into a tulip. Pours mahogany with a huge tan head. Nose is caramel and toffee, and the taste follows. Classic Belgian abbey ale Delicious.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2016 Pours very dark with a greyish foam head, had this as drought beer. Taste is like roasted fruits, slightly sweet. Aftertaste is a bit too watery, not what I expected of it?s dark appearance. Still good enough and easy to drink!

Pours dark, murky brown with a very aggressive white to off-white head. Aroma is roasted barley, coffee, malts, some soft banana notes. Taste is very aggressive carbonated. CO2 prepares and activates your tasting buds for a very full, yet somewhat fresh taste, which is followed by a slight sweet aftertaste. The latter is then replaced with a gentle sour aftertase, leaving you nice roasty ending. A very fine dubbel.

Aromat bardzo przyjemny, świeży. Kojarzy się głównie z morelami. 
Jest owocowy, ale trochę wytrawny i rześki. 
W smaku ciemne słody, trochę ciemnego chleba, palony karmel. 
Goryczka niewysoka, ale bardzo wyraźna. Lekko ziołowa. 
Całość zaskakującą, ale bardzo przyjemna.
Ruby color with medium creamy brownish head and fruity smell. Raisins, dried fruit and brown sugar. Medium fruity sweet taste with bitter and malty aftertaste. Medium and creamy body,

Bottle, 33 cl: big creamy tan foam, lasted longer than average. Nice color, OK aroma. Despite a good first impression the beer failed to please me. The high ratings here may have increased my expectations too much. I wont be in a hurry to give this one a second chance.

750ml bottle, only 6.5% labelled ABV, rather than 7.5%. Deep brown with ruby red pour with large billowing tan head that recedes fairly quickly. Big caramel aromas, with dark fruitiness - raisins, plums, dates, a little cherry. The taste is more watered down than I recall previously (perhaps the 1% ABV difference), but has some of the expected caramel, date, a little raisin and plum, plus some bready malt. Thin body and high carbonation. A little disappointing, given what I remember previously.

Aroma of fruit, malt and some raisin or other dried fruit. Taste is much of the same, but including yeast and some caramel. Maybe mine was to cold in the beginning becouse the taste get better and better. I think this one was to carbonated.

Bottle 33cl. Dark brown, beige head that fades quickly. Beer is a bit watery. The aroma is sweet: brown sugar and fruits. The taste is not very complex: sweetish with a spicy touches. Nice but nothing special.

Bottle at home. Nice dark brown colour, big beige head. Roasted malty caramel, brown sugar and dried fruits, ginger, lightly peppery, bit metallic, smooth slightly bitter finish. Soft mouthfeel, medium carbonation, medium body.

Robe noire encre, fin col de mousse blanche.

Nez fruité, épices, malts, biscuits.

Bouche : fruits rouges, cerises, mûres.Douceur et épices.Corps assez ample, crémeux.Très bonne bière brune, douce et fruitée.

Bottle. Aroma of caramel, dark dried fruit and sweet alcohol. Murky brown with off-white head, fully lasting. Taste is moderate sweet and light bitter. Medium+ body, creamy feel, avg. carb., caramel and fruity finish.

Kolor: Ciemny brąz. Minimalne rubinowe refleksy u podstawy. 
Piana: Po otwarciu butelki gushing!
Piana początkowo dość obiecująca, wysoka, drobna, kremowa. Po jakiś czasie opada, ale ładnie krążkuje.
Sporo firanek pozostaje na ściankach, jak również kilkumilimetrowa obrączka.
Zapach : Zbożowy, słodowy, chmielowy. Wszystkiego po trochu. W aromacie śliwki, rodzynki, winogrona i toffi. 
Smak: W smaku estry owocowe. Głównie ciemne owoce. Trochę śliwek, moreli i rodzynki.
Na finiszu lekko winny i kwaskowaty posmak.
Goryczka krótka i przyjemne.
Alkohol dobrze ukryty. 
Wysycenie: Wysokie (aż za bardzo!). 
Podsumowanie: 

Bardzo ciekawy dubbel z interesującym profilem smakowym. Od zbożowego, przez słodowy na chmielowym skończywszy.
Piwo bogate w doznania smakowe.
Corsendonk​ otrzymywał wiele pozytywnych recenzji z całego świata za to piwo.
Jedynym mankamentem jest zbyt wysokie wysycenie.
Butelka pięknie malowana z tłoczonymi białymi napisami na szkle.
Piwo ciemnobrązowe, nieprzejrzyste. Dość trwała ładna piana. W aromacie słodkie, suszone owoce, ziołowość i lesistość. W smaku karmel i paloność. Wysokie wysycenie, pełne.

Pleasant surprise. Was expecting simple dark beer, but got well balanced, interesting and quite bold Dubbel. Complex maltiness that provides awesome balance, light toast, some caramel,
bready, some dark dried fruits, light yeast, some floral hops. Moderate to light sweetness with light bitterness. Pleasant
Beetje droge dubbel. Weinig zoet, hoppige smaak. Smaak gebrande mout alleen op afdronk merkbaar. Geen slecht bier maar niet zon mijn ding. Beetje waterig.

33cl bottle on 16-Dec-2016 in a long stemmed tulip glass. A dark redfish brown in volour with a thick tan coloured head. Aroma of dark fruits, malt and molasses. Full body and medium carbonation. Flavour of caramel, dark fruit, malt, hops and spices. Light bittersweet finish.
UPDATED: FEB 19, 2017 God og spændende øl, der varmt kan anbefales. Gode smagsnuancer, med lidt for meget karamel.

Bottle (6.5%) from Tallinna Kaubamaja. BB 26/08/18. Pours ruby brown with a creamy light beige head. Good retention and lace. The aroma is candi sugar at first, then rather quickly softening to more malty and toasty, with notes of dark (dried) fruits and bitter forest berries, with a spicier (kind of herbal, grassy) side also opening up. Pine needles, too, perhaps. And a hint of cinnamon at times? Tastes caramelly-toasty-roasty, nutty, moderate sweet with a bit of herbal and berry-like bitterness following. Also, at times the tiny sweetness of cinnamon. Body lightish to medium; very crisp carbonation, which prevents it from any stickiness that Id associate with the caramelly character. Pretty (nutty) dry on the palate, with a soft texture. Its pleasant, as well as interesting, but unfortunately I cant say Im a big fan...
Bottle. Deep amber color with a medium sized foamy off-white head. Aroma of yeast, sugar and vegetables. Medium sweet taste with some bitterness. Medium to full body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Fördjupande läsning hittar man i min recension av Corsendonk Blanche. Om den här kan man tillägga att den är ett par pinnhål bättre, men den skrupelfria affärsmodellen lämnar en dålig eftersmak i munnen. Anor är inget man kan - eller borde kunna - köpa för pengar, inte ens i vårt genomkommersialiserade tidevarv.
Bottle. Dark brown wood appearance with brown foam. Sweet toffee aroma. Malty sweet taste with caramel toffee notes and a touch of hopy bitternes.

Rossa scurissima con riflessi color rubino, schiuma beige di persistenza medio-bassa.
Aroma di coriandolo, leggera cannella, banana matura, caramello, note tostate, lievemente vinosa.
Al palato sempre coriandolo, banana matura meno in evidenza mista a note di uva passa e frutti rossi. La coda acquista complessità man mano che la birra si scalda: note tostate e di cacao, leggero erbaceo, nocciola tostata, lieve grado di acidità, il tutto discretamente persistente.
Corpo medio, medio-pieno, ben carbonata.
Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, torkad frukt, jäst, toffe med toner av jord och örter. Fruktig, mycket kolsyra, lagom sötma, liten lätt syrlighet, fin beska.

Bottle - Dark brown colour, large, stable tan head, lacing. Fruity nose, dried plum, red berries, yeast, caramel, roasted nuts, low hops. Taste is sweet malty, breadcrust, fruity esters, dried plum, cloves, light chocolate notes. Medium to full body, average carbonation, oily texture. Really nice belgian ale.
chestnud color liquid with yellowish head. Aroma of rye bread and caramel. Tastes same, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation,

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0.33L.
Dark brown body with a large, creamy, tan head, fully lasting with nice lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy malty (roasted, caramel) and light yeasty aroma with moderate-to-heavy notes of dark fruits and light spices.
Moderate sweet and light bitter flavour with a fruity finish.
Medium body with oily texture; soft carbonation.
Nice and interesting.
From the tap poured a nice brown brew with a nice brown head. Wonderful aromas and flavors of chocolate, coffee, and malt.

Butelka 0,33 l. Zawartość alkoholu 6,5%.
W aromacie karmel, paloność, a także nuty przyprawowe.
Barwa ciemnobrązowa, lekko zamglona. Piana beżowa, z początku obfita, dość szybko opadła do cienkiej warstwy, ale pozostała już taka do końca.
W smaku umiarkowanie słodkie. Wyczuwalny karmel, w tle suszone owoce, nuty przypraw.
Na finiszu lekko gorzkie. Wysycenie średnie.
Bottle, 33 cl. Overall smooth, intense mouthfeel. Had expected a more complex aroma, though.

Bottle looks impressive - that´s why I bought it. Color is dark brown and you can even see all the CO2 bubbles. Head is nice and strong. For me the taste is slightly disappointing. Was expecting something with more profound and long lasting taste. This is just slightly ordinary dubbel.

0.33l bottle. Pours in black color with medium size light brown head. Aroma of cacao, chocolate,cookies, herbs.medium bitterness, medium sweetness, lightly sour. Medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, astringent roasted bread finish.

0,33 bottle. Pours dark brown color with large, mostly lasting off-white head. Aroma of vanilla, chocolate, yeast, toffee. Flavor is roasted, chocolate, light sweet, light bitter. Smooth. Finish is average long, roasted notes, light sweet. Medium to full body, oily texture, lively carbonation. Very good.
0,33l Flasche. Dunkelbraunes Bier mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Riecht nach Röstmalzen und Hefe. Schmeckt sehr ausgewogen nach Malz und reifen Früchten.

Dark Red-brown color with a beige head. The aroma is fresh and roasted. The taste itself has notes of roasted malt and bittersour fruits with a spark on the tongue. Actually a very complex beer but with a smooth taste. Overall fantastic.

Look; fawn fragile but standing head, brown body. Aroma; milky chocolate, nuts n berries, roasted soft malts, juicy meadow-fruity scents. Taste; brown malts, chocolate notes, dark fruits, nuts, wood, roasted malts, milky cognac notes, cocoa notes, that juicy-yeasty belgian impression - leading to a fruity malty finish, lingering, slightly dry, mostly juicy n soft. On palate nice and good. Overall; quality brown ale with a belgian fruity twist. Very good! [33cl btl, abv6.5%, BB03.06.2018, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Ersboda SE]

75cl bottle, shared with friends. Served in tulip glass. Pours dark brown topped by beige froth. Aroma is brown sugar, sweet malts, dark fruits and licorice. Very similar taste with hints of smoke and yeast. Moderately sweet on the palate, far from cloying as it should be. Medium body, good carbonation. Very nice Dubbel.
Mørkt rødbrunt med høyt skum. Vinøs duft med hint av karamell, nøtter og tørket frukt. Smaken er svak, men med samme toner som duften. Såpeaktig avslutning. Mye kullsyre.
Bottle from Belgiuminabox. Pours muddy dark brown with a low tan head. Aromas of raisins, caramel, roasted malts and almonds. Taste is caramel, raisins and walnuts.

Foam - fine-grained, moderately resistant. The aroma of spices, caramel, marmalade, and oiliness, and the characteristic "basement" note, which fits into the overall "bouquet".
Carbonation is not high. The body is dense and buttery flavor can be distinguished caramel and fruity "notes" on unobtrusive, slightly perfume background. The finish can be traced distinct dryness, after which all its glory manifested spicy and fruity tones. Beer is drunk very nice and gently envelops.
The aftertaste is shown tangible dryness. caramel, fruit, spices, perfumes. Fairly balanced and pleasant beer.

750 ml bottle at Rudis Beerhouse, Chania Greece. Pours a hazy dark red color with a beige head, Aromas of caramel, red fruits and belgian yeast. Taste is sweet, with caramel, spices, sugar, yeast, bready notes. Medium body with medium to high carbonation.

Zapach z butelki karmelowy, lekko chlebowy z nutami -przyprawowymi. Piana początkowo bardzo wysoka, średniopęcherzykowa, beżowa, syczy i dosyć szybko traci na wysokości, ale nie opada całowicie pozostawiając cienki kożuch. W barwie piwo jest miedziane, właściwie całkowicie klarowne. W aromacie ze szkła intensywnie fenolowe - jest guma do żucie, korzenne przyprawy, ciasteczka, karmel, nieco ciemnych owoców, czyli wszystko to, czego należy oczekiwać od dobrego dubbla. To co rzuca się wraz z pierwszym łykiem to zdecydowanie zbyt wysokie wysycenie - jest gryzące i z początku przebija się spod niego niewiele smaków. Pomieszałem trochę szkłem i było już lepiej - piwo jest karmelowe, ale przyprawowość, suszone owoce, oranżada bardzo wyraźnie się tu przebijają. Goryczka nie jest niska - głównie alkoholowa choć też z korzennymi nutami. Odfermentowane wysoko ale nadal dosyć słodkie i pełne w odczuciu. Mimo to naprawdę pijalne.
Bottle 33cl, pours a deep dark colour with a beige head, aroma of dark dried fruits, easy to drink, good
Dubbel bem diferente. Leve e com razoável drinkabilidade. Menos doce que uma dubbel padrão. Vale a degustação. Tem um péssimo custo benefício. Recomendo apenas se estiver em promoção.

BOTTLE 33 CL at 6,5% ABV. Hazy red dark brown. Big beige head. A pretty common dubbel - toasted bread crust, light caramel malt sweetness and some spice (clove?). Also, some cereal sweetness with a touch of vomit. Easy drinking yet substantial body. Decent.
330ml bottle. Amber brown color with beige head. Malty and yeasty aroma, caramel, dark dried fruits, light wineous, light spicy. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

F: huge beige, not very long lasting.
C: dark reddish to brown.
A: malty, caramel, fruity and nice grassy and floral hoppy.
T: nice fruity malt, toffee, caramel, some spicy tones, yeasty, light earthiness, dry fruity tones, chocolate, medium body, average carbonation, very good beer from this style, there are many kind of hops in, worth to try.

Bottle from Belgian beer factory, as 6.5%. Dark brown. Nose is dark and dried fruits, brown sugar, bread. Taste is dark fruits, spicy and earthy flavours, raisin, some bitterness. Not long lasting. Disappointment.

L:
-pours a ruby brown
S:
-almost nothing aside from a general sweetness
T:
-some caramel,some raisins,some plums,brown sugar
O:
-Pretty disappointing Dubbel
Stor smag. Den har karamel og fin smag af den belgiske gær. Den har også let bitterhed i eftersmagen.
75cl bottle. While having quite a soft aroma, the crisp and softly bubbly palate makes this malty and sweet beer very easy to drink. Almost too easy. And still very tasty at that!

Bottle from mixpack bought at Systembolaget. 6,5% ABV.

Dark reddish brown colour, just a slight haze and a big eruptious off white/grey head. 
Malty aroma with notes of burnt sugar, spice and some lingon. 
Taste is sweet malty with burnt caramel and dark bread, yeast, spice and red and dark berries. Dry slight spicy finish. 
Medium bodied, soft mushy carbonation, slight oily.
0.33l bottle. Dark brown color with lasting tanned head. Aroma is dark fruits, caramel, mint and raisins. Taste is burnt sugar, caramel and fruits. Overall its good Belgian ale.
Bottle in Brussels. Dark brown body with beige top. Nose of brown sugar, bread, chocolate. Taste is malts and caramel, well balanced and with some bitterness. Really nice finish.
330ml bottle. Dark brown body with a huge crown. Light aromas of dark fruits and syrup. Flavor is more yeasty with spices and earthy notes.

33 cL bottle. Dark, opaque brown color, with a bit, bubbly, beige head. The aroma is simple and pleasant, with notes of brown sugar, a touch of rye, black bread, and some baking chocolate. Sweet and malty flavor, with a subtle balancing bitterness. Medium to heavy body, chalky, chewy, and dry. This is a nice, simple, and well made beer. Lovely, malty nose, and unassuming flavor.

0,33 bottle (samplerpack) from systembolaget - Pours a dark brown with aromas of toasted bread, dark fruits and dark candy sugar. Mouthfeel is nice and well carbonated. Flavors of dark fruits and toasted bread. Not much else. Dry finish with a well balanced bitterness.
Flaska från SB. Brun röd färg med kaffefärgat skum. Dofter av torkade frukter. Fruktig smak utan överdriven sötma med en behaglig torr avslutning.

it says on the bottle that it has 6.5% instead of 7.5% as stated here it pours very dark with light brown foam which fades smell. is of candy sugar and yeasty medium bodied with some caramel dark malt flavor slight toffee its a decent dubbel

Flaska från beernavigator något år gammal. Stort skum, mahognyfärgad. Mycket kolsyra och småbubblig munkänsla. Massor av malt, känns fortfarande aningen kantig, lite kärv malt, rejäl sötma, kraftig, rustik, en inte helt integrerad beska. Kan säkert vinna på lagring något år till. Men när temperaturen stiger och kolsyran lagt sig mjukar den till en bra rustik dubbel. Gott
Deep brown color with a tan head. Caramel and dark fruits, matly. Balanced bitterness. Some raisin. No hop aroma. Medium-heavy body. Carbonation is balanced, too. Love it.

@ Havregatan 150727. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Malty, caramely and spicy with yeasty notes, dark fruits, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and malty with caramely and spicy notes.

Light roasted malt tones and hard roasted malt rises from the glass and during its nice foam is a hazy and almost black promising dubbel waiting. A little licorice, a little coffee, a little bitter orange peel and plenty of sweet malt notes with great burnt character.

The beer is beautiful, an absolute lust for the eye. The beer has a thick frothy layer of foam on top of it. The bulk disappears to leave a thin drape of almond colored foam. Really nice. The color is a deep dark ruby red. Beautiful. The smell is really nice. It is very herbal. It has some sweet fruit aromas, also chestnut, and mint. The smell is really special. All aromas give the smell a heavy, herbal spicy appearance. The taste is unique as well. Very spicy and herbal. The beer has some alcohol taste, but it complements the spicy herbal deliciousness. This beer can be surely recommended.
@ Agards väg 14/7-15. Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity and spicy with notes of caramel, also some yeast. Body is medium, the finish is dry with notes of spices.

Tap at muddy pig. 12oz pour in tulip. Dark brown almost black with smooth white head and good lacing. Subtle roasted aroma. Dark fruit and fig with some sour funk. Finish is quick. A bit tart. Raisin. Good complexity. Definitely a bit different and good.
Mörkbrun grumlig öl med smutsvitt skum. Doft av torkad frukt, mörkt socker fikon och viss jästig kryddighet. Detsamma återkommer i smaken.

33 cl bottle. Dark brown color with perfect foam. Aroma: raisins, caramel, yeast, a little spice like clove and coriander. Taste: well balanced, sweetness, dried prunes and raisins, roasted, caramel, esters, wine and cinnamon.

Dark brown color, big beige head. Aroma of caramel malt, burnt sugar and dried fruits. Dry seet taste with mildly bitter finish. Medium body and strong carbonation. Unusually dry for the style, but nice dubbel.
Pours muddy dark brown with a low tan head. Aromas of raisins, caramel, roasted malts, nuts, apple. Taste is caramel, raisins, nuts, apple. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Pours cloudy brown with low off white head
Aromas of dark malts, hints of molasses, mud, hints of caramel
Taste has belgo yeast, caramel, hints of molasses, hints of dried fruits

Pours cloudy mahogany with a finger of off-white head. Aroma of nuts, toffee, malt, brown sugar. Taste is sweetish malty and sugary, somewhat unbalanced. Body is medium full and smooth with soft carbonation.

Bottle. Clear brown body, medium beige head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, dried fruits (plum and raisin). Flavour jas caramel, chocolate, dried fruits, alcohol. Medium bitter finish. Chocolate after taste. Full body, medium carbo. Nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dunkelrot bis braun mit starker Schaumbildung. Angenehm malzig und leicht süß mit deutlicher Alkoholnote. Aromen von Beeren, Kirsche und Gewürzen. Gut.
Mooi donker bier met een grote schuimkraag, slaat wat snel neer. Smaak is lekker zoetig, al bij al een prima biertje
Semi-sweet, caramel aroma with hints of dark bread. Yeast, dark caramel and hints of vanilla in the taste. Very nice aftertaste mixing sweetness with moderate bitterness.

0.33l bottle. Clear rubyish brown body, beige head. Aroma of caramel, berries, chocolate and cherries. Taste of cherry, chocolate, toast, floral hops and only a hint of nutmeg. Sweet upfront, but it finishes dry. Awesome.

De couleur brune pas trop foncée on voit encore à travers la mousse est légèrement coloré elle a une ténacité correcte
Honey vas sentir des arômes légèrement chocolaté des notes de fruits secs
En bouche elle va être assez douce pas trop ta mère on va sentir de légère saveurs de chocolat de chicorée de noix 
Cest une bière vraiment intéressante

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2015 Pours dark brown, almost black, and with lacing tan head. Aroma is yeasty, caramel malt and a light fruity note. Flavour is dark malty, caramel and with a light spiced note. A solid fruity flavour takes over before the finish. Fruity and yeasty spiced finish. Light bitterness and a lingering fruity note.
Cor marrom, brilhante. Espuma boa e média persistente. Aroma de frutas secas e malte. No paladar cacau, biscoito e ameixa. Vivaz. Retrogosto levemente adocicado.

Barwa ciemno-miedziana, brunatna, z jaśniejszymi przebłyskami. Piana biała, średnio obfita. Aromat ciemnych słodów, suszonych owoców, skórki od chleba, przyprawy. W smaku spore bogactwo różnych nut - chlebowych, piernikowych, owocowych, karmel i lekki alkohol. Dobry balans i wyczuwalna goryczka. Odrobinę za wysokie wysycenie.
Bottle from Systembolaget (mixpack). It says 6,5% and Pater - Dubbel on the bottle though. Fruity smell with dried fruit and some caramel. Similar taste. A bit creamy. Noticeable alcohol.
33cl bottle from systembolaget mixpack. Pours nut brown with big white head. Nutty caramell with some butter motes.
Super lekker bier! Donker, bruisend bier en beetje koolzuurachtig. Mooie schuimkraag en mooie donkere kleur. Caramel smaak met een heerlijke, licht bittere nasmaak. Heeft veel weg van Pawel Kwak.

Ibland kan högt ställda förväntningar göra en obehaglig verklighetsupplevelse mer smärtsam än nödvändigt. Allt med belgisk flagga på är alltså inte guld. Det har vi fått erfara nu och världsbilden blev därmed lite tråkigare.
Brown beer with a beige head. A brown abbey ale, that distinguishes itself with a spicy tast. What really stands out is the taste of pepper. Very enjoyable.
Bardzo mocno fenolowe piwo. Czuć goździki oraz karmel. Piana bardzo ładna
Mørk brun klar med fingerhøyt lys brunt skum. Røde bær, svisker og noe trevirke. Søtlig smak, brunt sukker, vanilje. Noe bitter brent karamell og noe røkt i smak. Fyldig.
Spicy, slightly roasty, drier than usual for the style, also more roasty, ruby/Brown colour, medium head.

Rojiza oscura, casi negra. Abundante espuma, agradable aspecto. Aroma muy afrutado, manzanas, y también a pan. Muy rica y compleja en boca, uvas, manzanas, muy aromática. En medio se percibe un gusto alcohólico ligero, calentito. También dulce caramelo. Redonda y muy sabrosa.
Blandat fyrpack flaskor från SB. Mörkt bärnstensfärgad med rejält med beige skum. Sötaktig doft av jäst och karamell. Ganska lätt i smaken med frukt, jäst, choklad och karamell.

330ml brown bottle poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is hazy dark brown with a large frothy light-brown head that reduced fast, leaving a little lacing behind. Aroma of herbs, dark bread and caramel. Flavours of herbs, dark bread, spices, caramel and a hint of lemon zest. Taste is light-medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium-light bodied, soft texture and fizzy carbonation. Corsendonk Pater marketed as a Dubbel is odd and somewhat unbalanced for the style, its a bit soapy with less of a malt presence than I had expected, a herb-like flavour is dominating. Surprisingly light body for 7.5% ABV.

Flaska systembolaget. Brunröd kulör med stort fluffigt ljusbrunt skum. Doft av torkad frukt, äpple och hö. Lätt rostad smak med lätt fruktsötma. Brödig med färskt hö, örter och övermogna äpplen. Bra tryck i kolsyran och frisk fruktig syra
Deep dark fruit aroma. Brown and ruby body. Strong off-white two-fingered head. Mild bitterness. Crisp dark fruity taste with a dry finish.Warms the palate nicely.
Aroma of roasted malts and dried fruits. The taste is sweet and pleasant but lacks body.

Sample at Systembolaget. 

Dark brown with a large tan head. Aroma and taste of light roasted malt, caramel, dried fruit and light spices. A descent one.

Bottle with expiry Dec 2017. Black colour, frothy head, no lacing. Weak aroma dominated by candi sugar. Alcohol very well hidden. Medium sweetness. Fizzy carbonation, but very thin texture and abrupt finish. Feels empty, boring.
Fig and raisin aroma with a touch of oak. Taste is light chocolate, caramel malts, sour berries and dark fruits.

Piana bardzo wysoka  2/3 szklanki Beżowa, dość szybko opada, średniopęcherzykowa. Barwa bursztynowa. Aromat chmielowy, żywiczny, typowy dla tradycyjnych odmian chmielu. W smaku fenolowo-estrowy, mocno dojrzały banan,morela(?)  ogólnie świetne. Alkohol niewyczuwalny, wysycenie w szklance niskie. Malowana butelka  przepiękna! Goryczka zaznaczona, krótka.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do 16/12/17. Ciemno brazowo-rubinowe, lekko metne, z prawie biala, ladna piana, choc nie utrzymujaca sie zbyt dlugo. Aromaty slodowe - karmel, chleb, nieco owocow, nieco przyprawowosci (dosc duzo tej ostatniej jak na dubla, w tym gdzies tam jakas kolendra - mimo, ze jej chyba nie bylo w skladzie). W smaku podobnie - jest goryczka od alkoholu chyba bardziej niz od chmieli, ale to sie calkiem ladnie naklada jedno na drugie. kwaskowate owocowo w smaku, slodkawe w posmakach. dosc orzezwiajace. malo ciala. wysoko wysycone. calkiem niezle, gdyby nie ta przesadna przyprawowosc w aromacie, byloby bardzo niezle ;)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Dark brown colour. Beige head. carame, roasted malts, coffee. dried dark fruits, banana. Full bodied, malty taste.
Coloração escura e espuma duradoura. Sabor com leve amargor e suave devido ao teor alcoólico não muito alto.

2013 bottle. Pours a nice brown color with an off white head. The aroma is chocolate, raisin, fruit, earthy, not as sweet as it sounds. The flavor is sweet, raisin, fruit, very light pepper. The finish is sweet, than a light spicyness. Medium/full bodied with moderate carbonation
330ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours dark brown with an off white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, caramel and malt. Sweet finish.

NOTA DE CATA: 
- Color: Corsendonk Pater Dubbel presenta un color caoba oscuro. 
- Olor: Aroma de ciruelas frescas y otros ésteres de baya. 
- Sabor: El sabor se compone de más frutas más oscuras, un toque de humo, junto con las notas de aroma mencionado anteriormente. Sensación de boca extremadamente suave.

Bottle 0.33 l, Lidl, Wrocław, Poland.
Ciemnobrązowe piwo z jasnobeżową, obfitą i puszystą pianą oraz lekko przypalanym aromacie. W smaku lekko karmelowe z wytrawnym, przypalanym finiszem.
Taste: Roasted malts, earthy, sour, alcohol, dark fruits. Full bodied, but too much carbonation. Dry finish.
A great dark beer. this is an excellent example of a Dubbel. It has a creamy tan head that lingers and has an excellent earthy aroma that is a great match to its rich malt flavor
karmel, drożdże. kolor rubinowy,piana średnia, Goryczka wyczuwalna, ale nie mocna, dość wysoko nasycone :D
Dry and overraped fruits on nose. Some banana, some plums, nuts and light caramelised sugar in taste. Dry finish with sour hints. Just a dubbel.

Butelka 0.33l (09.12.2017). Barwa ciemno miedziana, opalizujaca z jasnobezowa, obfita, kremowa piana, mega trwala i ladnie krazkujaca. Aromat slodowo-owocowy, delikatnie winny, swiezy, calkiem przyjemny. Smak pokrywa sie z aromatem przy czym bardzo przyjemny posmak wprowadza charakterystyczna belgijska, owocowa nuta. Alkohol swietnie ukryty, w miare wysokie wysycenie ale pije sie przyjemnie choc milosnikiem belgii nie jestem wiec ocena calkiem dobra.

15.04.15. Quite intensive sour note in aroma with some caramel. Large head but quickly disappearing to ring. Dark brown colour. Complex taste of rosted malts, pleasant alcoholic bitterness with refreshing acidity and dry body. Something went wild in here. Quite good, but not what I have expected.

Aroma: banana, dried fruits, bubblegum, some nail polish in the background
Taste: medium sweet, banana, fruity, alcohol in the background

Butelka 0,33l. Moj egzemplarz tego piwa kompletnie mnie zawiodl. W aromacie czulem tylko metalicznosc i lekki alkohol. W smaku bylo troszeczke lepiej, bo delikatnie czulem rodzynki, skorke od chleba, ale tez niestety metal. Slabo sie to pilo, niestety.

Bottle at Piccadilly, Bodø. The color is deep, reddish brown with a creamy, beige head. Aroma of dried fruit, leather, heather, forest floor and some cocoa and smoke. Pretty complex. The flavor follows up with additional tones of leather, wood, liqourice and dark berries. Has a slick and silky mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A really complex and one of a kind dubbel with nice smoke in the background.

w zapachu melasa i karmel, drożdże, trochę dzikości i owoców. kolor rubinowy, jak cola, lekko, równomiernie zmętniony. piana średnio obfita, dość trwała. dosyć wytrawne, owocowe, świeże, trochę dzikie, lekkie nuty drożdży. goryczka praktycznie niewyczuwalna, ale dość długa i czysta. bardzo wysokie nasycenie
75 cl. champagneflaske leveret i flot metal dåse. 7,5 % . Mørkt øl af den fornemme slags smager fantastisk.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 The colour is classical dubbel dark brown with ruby reflexes, the head is small and quite unstable. Not very intense buquet of dried fruits, caramel and belgian yeast followed by some iron note. Light coffee, caramel and raisins notes in the taste, but the metallic accent is so strong and dominant that makes the beer really hard to enjoy. The odd thing is that I tried the beer before and was a lot better with no metallic taste at all. Maybe Ive chosen the wrong bottle this time.
Bottle @bar. Pours very dark amber. Aroma roasted malts, caramel. Taste little sweet, roasted, bit of caramel, Bit dry finish.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2015 Bottle bought in Belgium and drunk at home. Dark colour, short lasting head. Light caramelish smell. Caramel, coffee aroma at first. Quite dry for a dubbel. Then a strong sour and unpleasant metallic taste. Not good for me. I wonder if the guys who rated it good had the same brew. 2.0

rerate 15/10/2015
Better bottle this time I think. Same impressions but no harsh metallic sourness this time. Aroma are light caramel and red fruits, no roastiness compared to other dubbels. Flavour is still subdued to me. Very dry for a dubbel but some good hops and decent body with fizzy carbonation. 3.0

Aromat: kolendra, alkohol, trochę chlebowych nut, suszone owoce i na szczęście w tle odrobina metaliczności
Wygląd: ciemny bursztyn, piana potężna, ale szybko zanikająca.
Smak: jest kolendra, sporo fenoli, jest skórka chleba, są rodzynki, czuć na końcu alkohol, całość lekko musująca... ale to wszystko trochę taka druga liga. Niby poprawnie, ale absolutnie bez szału.
Aroma is caramel, coriander and Belgian yeast. Dark ruby colour with tall tan head. A bit sour in the taste, moderate caramel-like sweetness, bitterness is low. Overall average abbey dubbel.
Przyzowity dubbel z charakterystycznymi dla stylu nutami, ocena na RB zasłużona.

Aroma: roasted nuts, oak; Appearance: pale brown, large frothy head; Taste: medium sourness, slight sweetness; Palate: light body, slick texture, average carbonation, bitter finish

Nicely dry and aromatic ale. Yeast in acceptable proportions.

Aromat suszonych owoców, alkoholowy, karmelowy, skórka od chleba, ziołowość, jakby kolendra. Piana obfita, całkiem szybko redukuje się to prawie że obrączki, słabo zdobi szkło. Piwo koloru brunatnego, klarowne z rubinowymi refleksami. Piwo jest kwaskowe, , goryczka zdecydowanie niska, smak kolendrowy, goździkowy, ogólnie ziołowy ciężki do sprecyzowania. Piwo troszkę zbyt mocno wysycone, całkiem pijalne, pozostawia posmak skarpet - utleniony chmiel. Ogólnie całkiem niezłe piwo, połączenie dobrego pszeniczniaka z ciemnymi chmielami. Orzeźwiające.

Aromat: na pierwszym miejscu kolendra oraz wyraźne estry i alkohol. W tle nuty słodowe (chlebowe, karmelowe, melanoidynowe). 

Barwa: rubinowa, klarowna. Piana ecru, średnie i duże pęcherzyki, początkowo obfita, ale niezbyt trwała.

Smak: wyraźna słodycz, złamana kwaskowością. Estry, przyprawy, nuty chlebowe, karmelowe, cukier kandyzowany i alkohol. Goryczka niewielka, praktycznie niewyczuwalna. Średnia pełnia, umiarkowane wysycenie, bardziej wytrawny słodowy i alkoholowy finisz.

Piłem to piwo przed laty, a obecnie sięgnąłem po nie jedynie z uwagi na promocję w Lidlu, bowiem w takich cenach belgów jeszcze w naszym kraju nie było. Nie jest to jednak to samo piwo albo mój gust się od tego czasu zmienił. Przeszkadza mi bowiem kolendra, dość często używana przez belgijskich piwowarów, jednak dla mnie niezbyt pasująca do ciemnych stylów.

Pours a dark brown color, topped with a beige almost light brown colored head. Aroma of caramel and some dark fruits, with noticeable yeasty notes. Taste starts sweet with again yeasty presence, some alcohol notes, and herbal bitterness in the finish. Not bad, but not my kind of stuff, really.

Butelka 0,33 z Lidla. Aromat typowo beligijski, drożdżowy, wyczuwalne nuty bananowe. Z wyglądu piwo prezentuje sie calkiem dobrze, kolor ciemnobrązowy, bursztynowy, klarowny, piana drobnopęcherzykowa. Smak dość mocno alkoholowy, kwaskowaty, ze srednia goryczką, nic zachwycajacego, nic niepoprawnego. Spore nasycenie, lekka wodnistość.Posmak zdecydowanie alkoholowy. Podsumowując srednie belgijskie piwo, mam wrażenie tak jak częśc moich przedmówców z Polskii, ze Corsendonk wyprodukował troche gorszej jakosci piwo na Polski rynek. To sa jednak tylko domysły, gdyż nie dane mi było spróbować oryginalnego piwa. Trzeba jednak dac duzy plus Lidlowi za tego typu posunięcia i przybliżenie polskich konsumentów z zagranicznymi piwami
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Bel arôme caramel, au palais caramel, alcool, malts. Bel équilibre, finale corpulente et longue.

Bottle 330ml from polish Lidl, pours hazy dark brown with very fast falling creamy colored head. Aroma almost not noticable, a little bit of barnyard, some peachy esters, bananas, yeast and alcohol. Taste is watery, almost no body. Once again I get the feeling that a brewery sells to Lidl its second category of beer or the beer is much to fresh and filled up much to early.

Bottle. Dark brown and a bit red color with light brown head that is quite thick but doesnt last long. Aroma has ripe fruits, yeast, plums, lots of caramel and some chocolate. Taste is quite sweet with notable carbonation and ends with some bitter elements. Flavors of caramel, ripe fruits, coffee and some spices.
Yeast and bready malt... nice raw bitter taste... big carbs... fresh fruit in the back... cool dubbel

Całkiem przyjemne, bardzo ładnie wyglądające po nalaniu piwo. W aromacie ani smaku nic super specjalnego nie ma, jednak trudno doszukać się jakiejś wady. Jest to dobre piwo, jednak bez niczego specjalnego.
Bardzo duża piana. Bardzo wysokie, szczypiące wysycenie. Przeszkadza to w cieszeniu się z całkiem dobrego smaku, fajnego, nieco ciemnego, nie wiem do czego go przyrównać.

Bottle. Overcarbonated, with persistent notes of solvent, metal and green apples. Apart from that, there is a lot of coriander, caramel, banana, subtle earth, dried fruit and liquorice. Light spicy finish. Light sweet, balanced by a subtle tartness. A flawed beer with potential.
Pours a dark brown glass. It has a rather bitter (not hoppy) aroma of dark chocolate.
Delikatne w smaku, o ?adnej g??bokiej barwie. Wyczuwalne nuty belgijskich chmieli, ale ogólnie nic niezwyk?ego.

Uitgeschonken in origineel Corsendonk bierglas. Donkerbruin licht troebel bier met koperkleurige gloed en beige rotsachtige schuimkraag die lang aanwezig blijft in het glas. Geur van rozijnen en hout iets zurig. Qua smaak in eerste instantie vrij droog, met tonen van geroosterde mout, rozijnen,    kersen, karamel, drop, lichte specerijensmaken van laurier, kruidnagel en zwarte peper, daarna interessante wijnachtige, iets zurige en redelijk complexe eiken houttonen, dit proef je niet zo vaak in dubbel bieren. De afdronk is zacht bitter, enigszins kruidig van de hop met een mooie peperige finish. Een interessant dubbel bier de Corsendonk Pater met een onderscheidend smaakpallet en verfijnde balans met goed verborgen alcohol.
Brown color with nice, big, rocky head. In aroma careml and rasin. Taste is the same. Medium body and sweetnes, creamy texture, drinkable.
Bottle. Pours dark amber with medium off-white head. Aroma of rasin, bubblegum, caramel. Medium sweet, medium bitterness. High carbonation. Some alcohol warming.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2016 Butelka 330ml / Aromat: korzenno-ziolowy, słodkie owoce, po ogrzaniu delikatny alk. Barwa: ciemne bursztynowo-rubinowe wpadające  brąz, klarowne. Piana: beżowa, bardzo obfita(nalewne na 3x) zbudowana z średnich pęcherzyków niestety niezbyt trwała, słaby leasing. Smak zbalansowany, słodycz złamana delikatnym wytrawnym finiszem, ziołowy, delikatnie wyczuwalne cytrusy. Alkohol dobrze ukryty, wysycenie wysokie, piłem naprawdę powoli jednocześnie to pisząc i do samego końca musujące. Poza tym pijalne. W porównaniu z odpowiednikiem stylu od Kom*sa niebo a ziemia, natomiast w porównaniu z GC 2014 Czesława trzeba sprawdzić bo nie pamiętam, obie butelki w piwniczce jak przyjdzie odpowiedni  moment zrobię pojedynek i porównam . /////edit//// Po otwarciu butelki 75cl zapakowanej w metalową ładnie zdobioną tubę z datą ważności 02.09.2017 podobne doznania, przyzwoite w stylu i ładnie zapakowane.
Bardzo obfita, nietrwała piana, dość wysokie nasycenie. W smaku lekka kwaskowość, bardzo wytrawne i pijalne. Aromat prawie niewyczuwalny.

Piana obfita, ale bardzo nietrwała, grubo pęcherzykowa, opada do zera po kilkunastu sekundach. Barwa miedziana, ciemno czerwona, opalizująca. Aromat lekko kwaskowy, winno-miodowy, czuć czerwone porzeczki, czereśnie, żurawinę a także rodzynki, suszone jabłka i lekką ziołowość. Jest też jakaś niepokojąca, bliżej nieokreślona nuta... W smaku wyraźna drożdżowość, melanoidyny w postaci skórki od chleba, czerwone i suszone owoce, czerwony pieprz. Piwo nie jest słodkie jak inne dubble, raczej słodowo-drożdżowe, goryczka likierowo-trawiasta, przyjemna. Nagazowanie średnie, pełnia dość niska, w afterteasie wino głogowe, przyprawy i goryczka alkoholowa. 
Całkiem udany, lekki i wytrawny dubbel - w przeciwieństwie do innych degustowanych na blogu bardzo pijalny, dość lekki, sesyjny, nawet rzec by można wodnisty.

Butelka. Barwa ciemno-miedziana z czerwonym odcieniem. Piana wysoka, biała, małe i duże pęcherzyki, szybko opadającą. Aromat wiśni, śliwki, przyprawy. W smaku wiśnie,rodzynki, gorzka czekolada, nuty korzenne. Wysokie wysycenie, z dodatkiem delikatnej goryczki. Alkohol dobrze ukryty.

Aroma: Molasses; wood; dark vinous notes; light caramel. Appearance: Dark cola brown with a frothy tan head that settles into a bubbly skin. Flavor: Raisin liqueur and caramel up front; fruity esters continue toward the finish, which is dry and woody. Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, effervescent carbonation, long finish. Overall: Pretty interesting stuff; much more hop character than Im used to in the style.

(Bottle 0.33l) Dark ruby, untransparent colour. Beige, huge, thick, creamy slowly falling head. Aroma: Yeast, esters, banana, plums, slightly roasted, soft toasted, soft chocolate. Taste: Medium sweet, esters, toasted malts, soft bitterness, soft and balanced, warming alcohol.
Aromaty owocowy, przyprawowy, delikatnie palony. W smaku słodowe, delikatnie owocowe i kwaskowe. Wytrawne.

Being a guy who likes his big beers with double digit abv and heavy mouth feels, I found this really refreshing. Light and mellow without sacrificing flavor. Fruity and sweet malts on the nose and taste buds. Nice light bubbly carbonation. Very palatable. Good beer.

Butelka z lidla - a jak! Kolor piwa bardzo ciemny bursztyn, minimalnie przymglony, bardzo nędzna piana, duże pęcherzerzyki, szybko opada i zostaje łatami na powierzchni piwa. W zapachu estry, lekkie melanoidyny, goździki. W smaku dosyć mocno gazowane, całkiem złożone ale zdecydowanie wodniste. Są nuty chlebowe, goździkowe, na finiszu majaczy posmak wiśniowy-winny. Goryczka na niskim poziomie, chmielu nie czuć wcale(tak ma być w dubblu). Ogółem jak za 5zł to nawet całkiem na wypasie ale gwintu to to nie urywa.

Delicious, and dark, and palatable, and the right amount of carbonation. The price is well worth it, and the bottle design is worthy of being put "on the wall" with the rest of the other great beer one has drank. Although I believe this would stand a bit taller than the rest...

Butelka 0.33l do 16.12.2017r. Na sam początek trzeba pochwalić wygląd butelki, która na półkę pasuje w sam raz. Barwa brązowo-czarna z rubinowymi przebłyskami, klarowna, jednak z mułem na końcówce. Piana obfita, koloru ciemnego beżu z drobnymi pęcherzykami, oblepiająca szkło. W aromacie estry, nuty kawowe, palone i alkoholowe. W smaku jest dosyć spora gorycz jak na ten styl, bardzo przyjemna. Piwo bardzo słodowe z wyraźnym ciałem. Są nuty karmelowe, alkoholowe i kwaśne. Pojawia się też na finiszu pumpernikiel. Dosyć dobry balans. Nasycenie średnie, w sam raz. Piwo pijalne i ciekawe, polecam.

AROMAT: Głównie słodowy. Lekkie nuty owocowe. WYGLĄD: Ciemnobrązowe, klarowne. Z mega obfitą pianą. Dość grubą, beżową. SMAK: Owocowy, niezby gorzki. Wytrawny finisz. PIJALNOŚĆ: Dość wodniste. OGÓLNIE: Ciekawy dubel. Przyjemny w odbiorze.

Butelka 0,33 l (09/12/17). Słodki aromat słodowy z nutami estrowymi (rodzynki) i fenolowymi (goździki). Piana drobna, koloru ekri, trwała (początkowo obfita i ładnie zbudowana), redukująca się do solidnej warstwy utrzymującej się do końca i potrafiąca nieźle tworzyć firanki na ściankach szkła. Piwo ma barwę ciemną, bardzo głęboki bursztyn, do brunatnej. W smaku podobnie jak w aromacie: słodowość, choć finiszuje subtelną wytrawnością. Zbalansowane w kierunku słodu. Goryczka chmielowa delikatna i szlachetna. Nagazowanie i pełna średnia. Bardzo smaczny i wart degustacji dubbelek, którego można sączyć z wielką przyjemnością.

Aromat karmelowy, czekoladowy, słodowy.
Piana wysoka brunatna, z czasem opada ale utrzymuje się do końca.
W smaku czyć wspomniany karmel, ciemną czekoladę, lekka wytrwana gorryczka na finiszu.

A bit lighter than belgian strong ale. Citrusy, fruity aroma and taste. I can recognize dried fruits, plums, tea. Pleasant to drink. Alcohol almost no existant in taste or aroma. Really noce. Recommended!
Dark amber color, rich but quickly disappearing head, nice lacing. Wonderful fruity, caramel, dried fruits and wine aroma. Fruity taste, rather sweet, medium bodied. Very good.
Bottle sample at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks beerandbeyond. Clear amber. Aroma of malt, caramel, candy and fruitiness. Sweet flavor with caramel, fruitiness and a bitterish finish. Medium-bodied.

Bottle 0.33l at Godot bar Ghent Belgium.Pour it dark reddish color with medium white head.On the nose chocolate sour.Taste and aroma of roasted malt, dark fruits, some chocolate.Little bit flat on the end.Nothing special for me.

On tap at Maria Eetcafé, Cologne. Clear, dark reddish brown with a creamy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Rich aroma of dried plums, black cherries, coconut, chocolate, caramel and coffee. Rather sweet taste which begins with dried plums and dark cherries. Chocolate, coffee and caramel develop and are followed by coconut. Short, minimally bitter finish. Full body, creamy mouthfeel, flat carbonation. Very sweet beer but still well balanced with that gentle bitterness in the end. The aroma and taste are unbelievably good. Very enjoyable!
UPDATED: MAR 22, 2015 Enyhén fémes, gyantás ízvilág ólumüveg, nemes-pincevilág. Egy miatyánk szükséges közben. Utóíze tartós, melengető, egyre mélyebben ölt testet.
Dark brown with rich creamy light beige head. Fruity aroma. Sour and mild bitter taste with yeast fruity notes. Remaining fruity aftertaste.

Deep garnet pour, tight toffee colored head, decent lace. Nose is soft dark fruit and roasted grain. More sweet than bitter. Middle is raisins, plums , hint cherry, hint tobacco, and malt. A lot going on in there. Finish dries a little with a bittersweet send off. Very drinkable.

Une bien agréable brune à déguster bien fraîche. Pas trop typée elle plaira aux amateurs et aussi à ceux tentés de découvrir les bières brunes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Grote fles. Donkerbruine kleur met een goede plakkraag die lang blijft. Aroma van mout, niet erg spannend. Smaakt niet heel vol, wat zoet,zuur en bitter. Ik ben niet onder de indruk.
Robe brune. Nez sur les épices, le chocolat, le caramel. Bouche à lattaque épicée, une touche de café, bulle discrète, finale épicée. Un brune épicée, agréable.

Bottle. Deep brown color, airy off-white head. Fairly dry, herbal tea aroma. Rich, sweet flavor that finishes with herbal, hoppy notes. Roasted malt. Full body, high carbonation. Would pair nicely with food.
*Old rating, best before 04/12/09.  Smooth and thick beer. Hints of alcohol, dried fruits, dark malt, caramel, not too sweet.

First off, I love their flagship offering but this is a bit boring.
Appearance: Dark copper
Aroma: Slightly metallic, leather. Contrary to the description I get no smoke.
Palate: Slightly malty with a leather finish
another boring belgian beer that smells, looks and tastes like some kind of sweet brown sugary mess.
Poured from a bottle, San Diego. Hearty aroma of yeast, fruit, sweet malts. Strong head. A perfectly solid Belgian.
Decent dubbel, not quite as sweet as some, which for me is a good thing. Quite high carbonation levels.

Gamle noter fra tidligere ølsmagning:

Duft 3,1 ud af 5
Smag 3,8 ud af 5
Useende 4 ud af 5
I alt: 6,2 ud af 10

Lots of barley, earthy hops coupled with some mild bready yeast. Quite unique bouquet for a dubbel. Just not very dubbel-esque, not appealing and a little muddled. Light fruits and caramel malt. More English dark ale, than dubbel to me. Noble hops add a little extra depth but a real head-muddling mish-mash. Unfortunate.
Bottle at home. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of caramel, herbal, yeasty, dark fruits. Taste is medium sweet, caramel, chocolate, yeasty, dark fruits. Bit overcarbonated.

This used to be a popular Belgian dubbel, but I have the impression it is less seen nowadays than some fifteen years ago. Originally a near-alias of Bornem Dubbel, it has developed its own character since production moved from Van Steenberge to Du Bocq. This rating is based on old notes when it was still brewed at Van Steenberge; in that shape, it was a dark bronze beer with a very thick and frothy, pale yellowish beige head and malt sweet flavour, caramelly and a tad chocolatey, with some dried fruits, estery, a bit metallic, candi syrup, yeasty and drying finish with some brandy-like alcohol and herbal hops. Not too bad, but very ordinary. Ill re-rate it soon in order to find out what Du Bocq has made of it, because I have to admit I have neglected this brand a bit in the past years.

330 ml bottle shared with Alex @ biermarket mtl A: molasses, perfumy, tobacco, licorice, brown sugar, raisin. App: brown reddish brown minimal white head. T/p: full body with sweet but short finish. O: something else. Aroma is full of surprise not for the faint of heart.

Bottle shared with Jo @BierMarkt. Aroma: molasses, a touch of chocolate, leather, licorice. App: dark brown, a tad reddish with small beige head. taste and palate: smooth, full body, medium sweetness with sweet floral finish. Average carbonation. Overall: far from my best double, something not pleasant to the palate. Too sweet for a double imo.
dark with a very thick head. aroma reminds me of cola. some sweet notes of chocolate and bread. overall good beer.
Léger goût de cuir laqué, pour une sensation collante et une finale asséchante.

Respectable brown dubbel. Its a bit sweet, with a nice aroma. Taste is not as good as some trappist dubbels such as westmalle. Comes in a very attractive 75cl bottle. Overall above avg for me but nowhere near the best

2013 bottle. The aroma is chocolate, raisin, fruit, earthy, not as sweet as it sounds. The appearance is nice brown, off-white head. The flavor is sweet, raisin, fruit, very light pepper. The finish is sweet, than a light spicyness. Medium in body, slightly thick. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
In bottle. Brown, rocky head. Not persistent. Copper. Almost clear. Chestnut honey, caramel, raisin. High carbonation. Not very intense and persistent at nose and on the mouth. Balanced and armonic.

Draught
Aroma-caramel, dark fruits
Appearance-brown, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-very good

(Bottle 0,33l)
Aroma: Light sweet, very light chocolate, very light yeasty-spicy.
Appearance: Dark brown-black color. Medium, beige head.
Taste: Light spicy, medium sweet.
Palate: Medium body. Light sweet finish.
Overall: Quite weak belgian.

In bottiglia. Colore marrone con riflessi rubino, schiuma fine e persistente. Aroma di frutta secca, frutta sotto spirito, caramello. Al palato corpo importante, gasatura buona ma non eccessiva, sentori di frutta setta e caramello. Finale con intensità media

0,33 l bottle from Biervana 
caramel, cereal, roasty, floral, barnyard, basement aromas, leaves, red, brown, hazy, minimal head, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, full body, oily feel, lively, long finish,
Overall: Vanilla, wood, sherry.Note: Bottle 750 ml at De Klomp. (Vintage 2004) Reviewed 2014-11-24.

Ar: nuts, caramel, floral, raisin, woody, dried fruits - fantastic and intense,
Ap: dark brown, dark and cloudy, small dark head,
T: medium sweetness, lightly bitter and little bit sour!
P: medium to full body, thick feel, lively, with long finish,
Great dubbel!!

Pours a clear very dark amber to brown body with a fluffy light brown head that has good retention. Nose has sweet chokolate and bisquit notes alongside an interesting yeasty twist. Taste has a slightly sour, roasty character and the finish is smoothly bitter. Carbonation is high with lots of small bubbles forming in the mouth, the high carbonation also lightens the palate.

Pours clear dark brown with a small compact, stable and lasting off-white head. Beautiful appearance. Yeasty, fruity and malty aroma. Clear notes of the sugars, some chocolate as well. Dark fruits, raisins, indeed the yeast... Nice spicy touch... Great nose. Taste is mildly sweet with a small bitter and a nice roasty tone. Nice, strong kick of the fruits, beautiful touch of the spices, small chocolate in the finish, underlying note of the caramel... Nice sweetish, porto-like tones, beautiful complexity in the malts... Aftertaste is a bit dryish, yet there still is a nice lingering sweetness in it. It truly is nice and very well balanced, yet it tends to miss a bit of oomph. Could have had a small alcohol kick to strengthen the taste experience. Medium bodied, smooth, yet creamy texture, bit sticky as well. Carbonation is quite lively with a bit disturbing feel on the tongue. Overall seen this beer is quite a nice one. Truly a great entertaining dubbel. Nicely balanced, very tasty and aromatic, but it misses a further refinement and a small oomphy kick.

750 ml bottle, labeled as Corsendonk Pater Dubbel Ale. Pours dark brown with a slight off white head, no lacing. Aroma of crisp malt, cocoa, bread, earth, slight grass. Has a very clean, dry feeling on the tongue, not very sweet with chocolate, herbal, and earthy notes, low bitterness. Medium body with lively carbonation, creamy texture, and a mellow, balanced finish. Has nice warming qualities for 6.5% abv. A very malt forward beer with a dry flavor and mouthfeel.
Bottle. Black color, tanned head. Aroma is sweet, bread, caramel, malts. Malty taste, bread, caramel.
Bottle. Brownish pour with a generous tan head. Nose has loads of sweets, vanilla, caramel and some chocolate. Taste is light estery, loads of sweet caramel, malts and some herbal notes.

Dark color, heady foam and tons o lace. Aroma of fig, raisins, soap, molasses, burnt malt and yeast. A solid natural dub. Doesnt poke around with too many flavors. The alcohol is potent but the figs and molasses create a licorice like flavor. Very nice.

Brune rouge foncée. Mousse beige généreuse, bonne rétention. Beaux dépôts sur les parois.
Arômatique sur le taostage et légèrement sucrée caramel. Fruitée et épicée, un peu de coriandre décelable. Peu de levure au nez. Houblonnage qui rappelle la pils de Urquell (le Saaz sûrement).
En bouche tout ça en très bien balancé, avec une grosse carbonation. Fin de bouche légèrement amère. Mousseuse en bouche. Peu de repères pour ce type de bière, mais très bonne :)

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2014 330ml bottle served in Chimay chalice.
A: Pours a dark brown cloudy color forming a huge and very fluffy beige head. Medium retention, however, it never disappear totally and leaves some lacings 
S: Quite spicy for a Dubbel. Smells Belgian yeasts, bready malts, coriander and brown sugar
T: Follows the nose: Belgian yeasts, brown sugar, brown bread, spices (coriander) and caramel malts. Very smooth and balanced Dubbel beer
M: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Milt earthy hoppy aftertaste 
O: Very drinkable. Excellent Dubbel
[ BA Review @ 4/6/2012 ]
Pours a dark brown beer with a good tan head. Smells malts, caramel and sweet. Tastes chocolate, roasted and malts. Lively carbo, thin body and a sticky texture.
Chocolade bruine kleur met een volle lichtbruine kraag. Ruikt fruit, crème, vanille. Smaakt lekker zoet, vanille, crème en chocolade.
Pours a medium brown with a huge foamy beige head. Nicely balanced dubbel with some figgy flavours and a bit of spice.
Dark brown body with a beige thick head. Aroma is yeast, spices, malt, dark fruits. Taste is medium sweet with medium bitterness. Nicely balanced and easy to drink.

"nice aroma and great flavor. worthy of its perch atop the style. slightly different and more complex than most or all dubbles ive had before, but hard to put a finger on. maybe more dark fruit and or a touch of vanilla in the flavor, yeast and sweet malts. deeeelicious. thanks John, this ones a winner."
Botella de 33 cl, en Cerveceria Internacional. Color marron oscuro. Sabor a malta tostada, caramelo, levadura.

33cl flesje via Jumbo, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 6,5%
Uitgeschonken in La Trappe glas

Uiterlijk: zwart met mooie crèmekleurige schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: caramel, donker fruit, kruidig

Conclusie: mooi donker bier van Corsendonk. Zoals een dubbel hoort.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
25 oz bottle poured into a tulip glass..amber/burgundy pour with an off white head..aroma of dark fruits,raisins,figs,brown sugar..dry,malty taste..bit too carbonated for my liking but not bad.
UPDATED: OCT 30, 2014 Deep brown, moderate head. Aroma of brown sugar, dryed fruit, chocolate. Medium body. Pretty sweet of taste. Roasted malt at finish. Good
Ruby brown. Aroma is raisins, apple and candy sugar. Taste is yeasty tang, toffee and raisins. Very dry finish. Overall, slightly above average dubbel.

Krachtig bruisend, intens donker bruin. Crème achtige schuimlaag die lang blijft hangen. Geur met hint van fruit, port, hout doet zoet aan. Drinkt zich makkelijk weg, voelt zacht aan met een zachte afdronk. Weinig smaak in het palet aanwezig, ontwikkelt zich langzaam. Meer geur dan smaak.

Brune sombre, collet imposant de bulles moyennes, persistant.
Arômes de fruits noirs, raisins.
Relativement ronde, prune, pruneau, peu damertume, plutot sucree.
Final long sur lefuit caramelise.
Donker bruin bier met veel schuim. Smaak is hoppig bitter en licht zoet met caramel en licht zuur fruit ondertoon. Erg goed.
Botella de 33 cl la ultima hacia junio de 2000 con fecha de consumo pref para 27-05-2001. lote 0599. cuerpo medio con 7.5 vol. Dominio de sabores dulces. No esta mal.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Murky brown body with a thick beige head. Nice lacing. Aroma of brown sugar, prunes and raisins. Flavour of wood, caramel and lightly roasted malt. Thin body with a slightly sticky texture. Overly fizzy carbonation. For me, Westmalle Dubbel has more depth of flavour, and a much better mouthfeel, but this is still a very good Abbey Dubbel.

Pours a dark brown with a substantial rocky head. Nose is grape, a little wine-ish, a little yeast ester, brown sugar. Taste is grape soda, a bit of chocolate, estery. Not very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Een dubbel dat net niet goed genoeg is vind ik. Nochtans ben ik fan van bruine bieren, maar van deze niet

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours clear dark reddish brown with ran head. 
Aroma dark fruits, prune, grape, caramel, roasted malts. 
Taste spice, caramel sweets, little roasted bitter. 
Mouthfeel creamy. 
Nice Dubbel.
Bij de bbq dit bier gedronken. Heerlijk bier met een mooie witte kraag. Mooie bruine kleur, zachte smaak.

Bottle shared by Barone. Aroma is dark fruits, prominantly figs and prunes and grape soda (in a good way). Pours dull brown with a big white soft head. Taste is spiced dates, prunes, and bubble gum. Very nice dubbel. Not too sticky sweet like some.

750 ml bottle. Pours hazy brown with tall, long-lasting, foamy off-white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of plums, cherries, caramel, funky yeast and brown sugar. Body is full and crisp. Spicy yeast, caramel malt, plums, raisins, brown sugar, minerals and herbal hops fill the mouth. Finish is long and spicy. Nice Dubbel.
Clear, dark brown. Airy, light beige head. Aroma has yeast, brown sugar, notes of dried fruit. Flavour is similar, plus a little spicyness. Light vinous finish. Lively carb, mouthfeel is fluffy.

Molasses dark brown flavors. Medium body. Thin fading very nice beer bit to sweet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Cafe de Kuppe, Brugge. Dark brown in colour, big white head. Aroma is some citrus, chocolate and some alcohol. Taste is fruit and chocolate in a creamy mix with a long lasting finish. Really tasty!

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2016 Cloudy brown color, big creamy brownish head with good retention. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Aroma of dark fruits, roasted malts, yeast, caramel. Very smooth, silky mouthfeel. Medium sweet, light bitter taste. Finish is slightly dry. Excellent Dubbel!-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Finom kis apátsági sör. Ki lehet fogni különslegesebbet is a Corsendonk közül, ez amolyan standard.

Habja gyönyörű és hosszasan tart, színe méltóságot áraszt. Az édeskés ízvilág helyett egy komlósabb, kesernyés-fanyar alapíz uralkodik, az idő múlásával egy erőteljes fűszeres aromával megbolondítva (leginkább a koriander az, amit érezni lehet). Illata sem hagy kétséget ízének alapvető jellegzetességei felől, a kettő remekül összhangban van.

0.33 bottle. Clear, brown color with a carmin tinge and a big, brownish head. Aroma has loads of malts but also quite a lot of yeasts, caramel, spices, and a touch of hops. Taste has a typical malty sweetness but also a hell lot of bitterness - not so good to be honest. Medium body, slick texture, and lively carbonation. Finish is a bit sweeter and a tad sourer but luckily less bitter than the taste, makes up a little bit for the lost impression. Overall the beer disappoints especially considering its beautiful aroma and the quality of other Corsendonks.

Tap at the Brouwcafe, Scheveningen. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy off white head and lots of broken lace. The aroma is big yeast, light malt. The flavour is medium bitter, light sweet, with a frothy yeast, roasted malt, liqourice bitter palate and a long bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Not bad but a bit one dimensional and old style Belgian.

Bottle that I almost forgot I had...date code 12/06. Thought 8 years might have been to long for this to hold up, but it did and did it well. Very lively and effervescent this had a real nice apple over barnyard funk to it. Very pleasantly sour as well. Awesome.
