user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Appears brown with a big off-white head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate and hops. A fine balance between sweet and bitter. The body is medium and the carbonation overrules it sometimes. Not as complex as other Dubbel beers, but fine in its own way and good with meat dishes.

Transfer from BA review on 4-14-12 - 
Poured from 750 ml bottle into snifter glass 

Appearance  Pours a hazy dark brown color with a medium tan head. The head has a moderate persistence but eventually fades to give some lacing.

Smell  The smell is bready and yeasty with strong dark fruit aromas. There are some lighter hints of banana, brown sugar and spice as well, mixing with the fruit and bread very nicely.

Taste- The taste is up front of brown sugar and dark malt; a nice brown bready flavor. There is a development of the dark fruit flavors mixed with some banana and spice more toward the middle of the taste. Theses linger on to the end where they mix with a yeast cake flavor which when mixed with the dark bread of the initial taste is very pleasurable.

Mouthfeel  The brew has a medium body with a slightly above average carbonation level. While the carbonation is a bit too high, as it takes a bit out of the smoothness, overall the mouthfeel is still not bad.

Overall  This is a good easy sipping dubbel. Good malty and fruity flavors make for a very pleasing experience.

Dégustée en bouteille de 330 ml au Bistro des bières belges à St-Hubert le 5 décembre 2012 au coût de $9.50.  Bière brune foncée servie trop froide. Col mince beige crème foncé assez persistant. Odeur de cognac, de fumée. Un peu forte, très sucrée, pas très amère. Saveur de mélasse en amorce, de fruits séchés (raisins/figues), un peu aigre en finale. Très bonne, style typique dune brune belge.
Mahogany brown with fair beige head. Aromas of dark fruits and molasses. Taste light sweet and bitter, umami trace. Texture slick, soft carbonation. Quite thin but very good.

One of the first Belgian beers I ever enjoyed back in the mid 1990s. Its been a few years since Ive had one, and I just realized I had never written a review.

The beer is chestnut brown with a substantial beige head that has plenty of staying power. The aroma offers a big dose of Belgian yeast, brown bread, alcohol. Very tasty beer. Big time yeast character with light warming alcohol. Easy drinking with a great feel on the palate. Bready, yeasty, malty, not too heavy, perfect carbonation level. Overall, a solid beer. A fine example of the style. This beer has stood the test of time and Im sure I will be enjoying a Corsendonk from time to time as long as I am able.

Appearance with a dark-colored (almost black), cloudy liquid and very tall and nice head of foam. 
Aroma of wood, clove and malt. 
On the palate, red fruits, roasting and alcohol. 
It is a great beer, I love Corsendonk, all of them are very good!
Backlog. Tried it bottled. Dominated by caramel, butterscotch and dried fruits with some herbs.

Bottle. Pours dark amber with a beige head. Aroma is dark fruit, caramel, estery, bread and sugar. Taste is somewhat mild and moderate sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is moderate. Finishes balanced and chocolaty. Somewhat simple.

Bottle. Pours dark brown, virtually all light is blocked when looking through the glass. Small fizzy foam head. Aroma of steel/copper, grapes and raisins, slight sourness. Taste starts with copper/steel again, raisins and hint of dark chocolate (which slowly intensifies). Little evolution. Aftertaste is sweet, caramel and chocolate. Taste improves a little half way the bottle, but this will not become a favorite.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2016 Bottle, 33cL. Home. A dark brown beer with mahogany hues at the bottom of the glass through the light ; big beige foamy head ; great retention. Roast, herb, fruits (blackberry), light chocolate. Light sweet, light bitter, gets stronger (medium), dry refreshing. Elegant fair body, average texture, average carbonation, fruity dry bitter lasting finish. Overall, really good beer ! Nice fruity chocolate bitter character ; good body.

Previous rating : 9-5-8-4-18 = 44 - 4/2014 (6.5% abv bottle)

Cervesa molt afruitada i maltosa, es nota també gust a caramel.
Cerveza muy frutada y maltosa, se nota también sabor a caramelo.

Bottle in The Macc. Dark amber brown with a thin off white head. Aroma of dark fruits and malts, some yeast. Flavour has some sweet malts, yeast and dark fruit, medium carbonation. Nice enough but nothing special in my eyes.
Dark brown, with no light passing when backlit. Aroma is sweet and malty. Flavor is dark fruit and chocolate malt with a slight lactic finish. From notes taken at Bier Paleis, Brugge on June 6 2007.
Bottle shared with the Benzai a long time ago at Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Nice abbey dubbel: dark brown colour, smell and taste malts, caramel, nuts. Good body and carbonation.
UPDATED: SEP 12, 2015 Aroma of malts, caramel, red and dark fruits, raisin, some brown sugar. Flavour is dark fruity sweetness, malty caramel. A very fine fruity Dubbel.
Bottle 330 ml at Pivkan, Zagreb. Pours dark brown with beige head. Malty and spicy aroma and flavor. Caramel. Emphasized sweetness.

Dark reddish brown, creamy off white head. Smells of malts, some belgian yeast, sweet dark fruits and an hint of alcohol. Taste stays on the same lines, very rich and pleasant. Light hops, sweet finish.
Fair beer. Floral and fruity. Thin head. Lacks body. The wash down is one dimensional. Ok but not earth shaking .
Duft av rosiner, eik og krydder. Mørk brun, nesten sort. Dekkende skum, heng langs kant. Nydelig fruktig smak, krydder og rosin.

Drank 20-3-2014. Nice dark with some foam. No particular smell, bit Sweetish. Tastes not Strong. Vague chocolate hint in the end. Carbonation is a bit too present. The beer is also too thin and slightly watery in the middle, between the carbonation start and the chocolate end.

Mahogany brown with hues of red. Big two finger beige head. The aroma shines with dark fruits, raisin, fig, date, brown sugar, caramel, ginger, a little nuttiness. Taste is like the nose but much more subtle. If the flavors could match the boldness of the aroma this would be a standout. The body is a little thin though, but a decent Dubbel.
Mokka medium head, black with a red glow, sweet cherry malty maple sirup smell, medium carbonation medium bitter, malty liquorise caramel taste
had this one a real long time ago, poured a hazy brown colour with a beige head. malts, dark fruits, yeasy. some kind of chocolate, and bitter chocolate, burned sugar. meeh

0,33L bottle, BB 06.02.2016. Pours dark ruby with huge off white head. The head stays. Aroma is dark fruits, raisins, spices, caramel, malt and phenols. Taste is sweet, yeast, dark fruits, and caramel. Finish has noticeable alcohol. Overall: drinkable, but nothing more. I would like to try older version to see if its better.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch nach getrockneten Früchten, Hefe, Karamell.
Geschmack hefig, Karamell, Früchte, leicht gewürzig.
Dark brown colour, some beige foam. Medium carbonation. Medium body. Sweet aroma with notes of brown sugar, dried fruit and banana. Light bitter finish.

Bottle @The Vintage, Leith. Pours dark brown with a slight red tinge, a medium tan head with some nice lacing. Fruity on the nose dark fruits over ripe fruit nose. Fruity in the mouth as well with a spicy aftertaste, this really improved once it warmed up.
Brown with beige head. Malt caramel and ripe fruit aroma. At taste is light sweet and smooth with sugar and old fruit flavour.
Mørk brun/svart farve med høyt beige skum. Lukt av maltt, karamel og fruktl. Smak av maltt, karamell, sjokolade og frukt. Fruktig og bitter avslutning. Vinonoolet.
Cloudy brown color , big beige head. Aroma of malt , caramel , fruits , chocolate. Taste is malty with dark fruits and chocolate notes. Full body , moderate carbonation. Bittersweet finish.
Caramel with fruity notes in the nose. Full body but rather carbonated. Taste of malt and caramel with some sourness. Good beer, but not as prominent as its price
Rich brown ale with a foamy white head. Fruity aroma with lots of mineral. Brown ale flavor with yest and lots of mineral. Pretty ok, Belgian style brown ale.

Colour: copper brown with a firm beige head.
Nose: syrup, candy sugar, yeast, chocolate, red apples.
Flavours: ripe forest fruits, chocolate, malts, coffee, caramel.
Finish: medium long, slightly bitter, more alcoholic.
Verdict: fine abbey brown, but slightly too sweet for my taste.

33cl bottle @ home. Dark brown color, strong brownish head. Aroma caramel, banana, brownsugar, malty, coffee and dark chocolate notes, slightly roasty and woody, alcohol is slightly present. Taste light sweetness, medium bitterness. Full body, creamy and sticky texture, lively carbonation, medium lasting bitter-sweet finish. Good dessert kind but just another belgian abbey beer, not very unique.
Dark in color with a small amount of foam. Lite chocolate, dark fruit, a twinge of sour and roasted malt is the aroma I get. Nice. Taste is similar to aroma with a bit a dryness. Real nice beer.

Bottle from a liqor store in Leerdam. The beer has a dark brown color and a nice cream colored head, CO2 is perfect. In the aroma tones of caramel, nuts and raisins. The taste is sweet, creamy and has the fruitiness of dry fruits. The finish is short and light bitter.
Nice little brown beer, not so strong but still decent.Good abbey beer, nice unusual bottle btw

330 ml bottle, pours dark brown with a very foamy white head. Dark malts with fruity belgian yeast esters and a hint of washing up liquid. finish is short and a little sweet. Pretty good but not amazing.

(Flasche) Es hat eine dunkelbraune Farbe mit einem rubinroten Einstich, ist unfiltriert mit einer bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma hat was von Brombeere und Rosine, Keller und dunklem Malz. Der Geschmack ist recht schlank, malzig, etwas samtig, mit geröstetem Malz und Harz.

Bottle. Clear dark red brown pour, Small white head. Aroma is caramel, very light roastiness, toffee, light winey notes. Taste is sweet, caramel, very malty, grainy, fruity, finishes dry, light roasty finish. Palate is full bodied, a tad overcarbonated. A bit heavy and aggressive, but still good.

75 cl bottle named pater dubbel. Unsure about abv. Label says 6.5% but the shell it came in states both 7.5% and 8.0% wtf ??? Taste has brown sugar and dark fruits. Medium bitternes and almost smooth mouthfeel.
Bottle from Voldby Købmandsgaard. Dark brown/black colour with a good off-white head. Roasted malts, caramel malts, fruits, hops, some spice. Dry alcoholic finish.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2014  Quite fruity and light for this kind of beer. Some burnt caramel and quite malty,  not too sweet,  light bitter. Nice,  but not very special. Mouthfeel is the weakest part. A bit watery.

Huge foam. Dark brown. Spicy yeasty rubber bread notes dominate. Some nobel bitterness. Alcoholic medium mouthfell.24/7-16 no rubber. Faint malty notes.

Aroma: caramel malt, ripe dark fruits, honey. Appearance: dark hazy almost black , big thick head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: caramels, light fizz, turning light sour. Overall: Very decent Abbey Dubbel. Bottle from Wittich Weine, Switzerland.
Donkerbruin met redelijke kraag.aroma van honing en caramel. Smaak is zoet met redelijke body. Bij de afdronk wat zuur.

A great belgian brown ale!! :)
Very good with a special taste
Different from other :)
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2014 Bottle. Nice and very fruity aroma. Tastes like a regular good dubbel bit with a lot of oranges.
A bit metallic and bland for me. Warms the back of the throat. Not overly impressed.

33cl bottle

Appearrance: Dark brown body with off decent size white head, some nice lacing. 
Aroma: Camerlised malts, with some dark fruits, a bit of yeast
Taste: Starts with medium sweetness comming from the camerlised malts. Then some darfk fruits and spices show up. Finishing with dry alcholic with a little bit of chocolat bitterness
Light body, spritzy carbonation.

Dark brown body with off white head, some nice lacing. Bready and dried fruit aroma. Dried fruit taste. And you can definitely taste the caramel here as well. Overall could be a bit more intense, but its a nice dubbel.

bottle at gollem
pours dark, clear and redbrown 
good white head
spiced smell ( coreander )
too high carbo
spicy, earthy , rather sweet taste . much coreander again . no real aftertaste

Bottle BB Jun 2015.  Pours mostly black with a cm of foamy off-white head.  Doesnt look that great really.  Smell is burnt plastic, cranberry, some alcohol comes through.  Body - medium, foamy, a touch of spritzy carbonation.  Taste - dates up front, there is a strange coffee-like flavour, its as though something savoury has been dipped in toffee, bubblegum, dry alcoholic finish.  OK.
11.2oz bottle - pours soopa dark brown with ivory head. Dark fruit and caramel with a latent hop kick. Leafy aftertaste. Moderately sweet. Kind of flat.
Dark brown, big white head. Fruits and syrup, spices, slightly burnt. Medium sweetness, light bitterness. Nice basic dubbel, surprisingly light though.
330 ml. bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown with a nice tan head. Aroma of malt, fruit, and spice. Taste is caramel malt, dark fruit, yeast, spice, and a bit of hops. Nice.

Bottiglia 33cl, ordinata su birraland e bevuta a casa.
Marrone con riflessi rubino, schiuma piuttosto persistente.
Agrodolce, corpo medio, carbonazione nella norma.
Intenso retrogusto di frutta matura.
Buona

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

Pours a dark brown with a slight reddish tint. Nose reminded me of a sour ale. Taste of malt, bitter chocolate. Ok - not a huge fan of the style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep red-brown color with tan head that had great retention. Nose had a terrific earthiness with a really faint hint of chocolate. Mouthfeel was delicate and flavor had a nice soft fruitiness with almost no carbonation. Not my favorite version of the style, but I would recommend it to someone thats a fan of the Belgian double.

Pours dark brown red, little hazy with massive head that sticks for a while. The nose..Whoe.....yeast right up front and fruits. I get oranges and tangerines, tutti frutti in there deeply hidden. Then the taste..hmm...hoppy, and some......uhm......uhm.....I actually could?nt say. licorice perhaps? This is a hard one to explain. Mouthfeel is on the medium to thin side. The hops surprised me a bit there but it?s a lovely beer. Passed the test.
Bu en bouteille de 33cl ; Une belle robe ambré-brune, une mousse légère. Une bière vraiment riche en bouche une pointe damertume mais avec beaucoup de malt au nez et en bouche. Excellente
Very hoppy for a Belgian beer. Lots of roasted malt, brown sugar, and spicy Belgian yeast, but citrus hops are also quite noticeable. I like this beer.
Bottle. Pours dark Brown with a Red hue and a Beige head. Aroma is Caramel and Belgian yeast. Caramel sweet with a good degree of yeasty spice. A textbook dubbel.
Pours a dark brown with fizzy white head. Lots of carbonation. Aromas of dark fruit and coffee. Similar flavors. Pretty good dubbel.

Tämä punertavan ruskea olut muodostaa päälleen vaalean beigen vaahdon. Tuoksultaan se on karamellinen, hedelmäinen, kevyen mausteinen ja sokerinen. Maku on makean leipäinen, hedelmäinen, mausteinen ja rusinainen. Hieman kuivaa katkeruutta on mukana paletissa. Melko tuhtia tavaraa.
Deep brown, khaki head. Nose is sweet malts, chocolate, dried fruits, and yeast. Easy palate, dried fruits, rich malts, yeast, light chocolate, very carbonated finish.

330ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours dark reddish brown with an impressive off-white head, which it maintains through high carbonation. Aromas of toffee and tobacco, some stone fruit. Taste has a dark sugar sweetness, roasted nut bitterness. Creamy texture, very smooth. Medium bodied, with a nice finish.

33cl bottle at Lobbes. Dark brown with a beige head. Full body with moderate carbonation. Sweet and malty with some bitter notes in the finish. Raisin, chocolate (much of it!), brown sugar, dark fruit and nuts. A very decent abbey dubbel!

Let sødlig maltet som en Brown ale. Snert af belgisk frugtighed i gæren, men for lille.
Rund men for lidt fylde. Lidt tør eftersmag og fad afslutning. Ikke en vinder men ok.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. Brown pour with a classic Belgian head. Aroma suggests something dark and malty with a fruity undercurrent. Red grape, raisin, date all in there. Good stuff. Chocolate malt taste with more fruity hints. Sadly its just a bit too carbonated for my liking. Pretty good dubbel.

Shared a 33cl bottle from Cora (Luxembourg). Pours a really dark brown colour with a thick tan head that disappeared during the tasting. Aroma is roasted, coffee and alcohol. Medium carbonation and quite full body. Flavour is bitter at start but turning quickly to a boring sweet. Overall a boring beer, not bad though.
The lack of assertive yeast in welcome in this dubbel, as it allows the malt and dark fruit (especially raisin) to show through. Problem is, those malt flavours are not particularly well-developed.

Oh, I like it almost for everything - aroma - yeasty, malty, herbal (coriander mostly), earthy and hoppy. For appearance - dark, mahogany, deep amber color, for creamy long lasting head, for palate - dry, for typical Belgian taste - sour, yeasty, bitter. And last but not least - for gentle, earthy finish.
Very good dubbel.

I think this is a premier beer. If you like Belgium style, you'll love this brown ale! Pours beautifully with nice head. Smooth, effervescent with mild chocolate and malty. I always have this on hand. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Serving: 330 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors. It pours a dark brown color with a rock tan head. The nose smells of dates, spices and bubblegum. Slightly sweet up front with the dates and dried fruit coming through followed by the spicy yeast and bubblegum notes. Finishes fairly dry. Medium bodied with higher carbonation.
Dark brown. Dark malt and caramel with alcohol in aroma and taste. Overall, all mediocre.to.average.dubbel.
Pours dark amber with lastinh off-white head. Sour, yeasty, sweet malt aroma. Flavour is spicy, sweet malty chocolate with tones of dried fruits. Short bitterness in finish. Nice!
lightly roasty, dark fruit, raisin aroma. soft and full taste of malt + dark sugar. balanced bitterness. chocolaty lingering aftertaste

Dark ruby color, big beige head. Aroma of plums, dark fruits, brown and candy sugar, nutty. Taste is light sweet, a bit tart and bitter, dark fruit flavor. Medium body, sticky texture, soft carbonation. Really nice

Intitially a bit malty, perhaps even fruity. Nice, creamy head. My enjoyment of this was hampered only slightly by a very subtle alcohol taste, almost as if it were a cocktail instead of a beer. Still very good, and worth a try.

One of the best dubbels i have ever had. Period. 
Learn an Irish accent effortlessly. Repeat after me: 
Whale
Oil
Beef
Hooked
Now, say it fast.
Couleur tres sombre, et mousse epaisse. Parfum fruité. Arome de caramel leger, un peu de fruit. Gout plus maltéavec bonne fin de bouche.

Bottle from Den Gouwen Aar @home
Pours dark brown, medium offwhite foamhead, good lacing. 
The aroma is malty, caramel, roasty. Taste is a good balance between sweet and bitter, not too much on either side. 
Medium body, medium carbonation. Finish is not abrupt and only a little bitter.
Great beer, for many occasions.

33cl bottle into tulip glass

Overall: Drier than most abbey browns, which is refreshing. A little deficient in flavor - not overly complex. Still a very delicious beer. 

Appearance: Dark brown/black with ample tan head. Some lacing on the glass.

Aroma: roasted malt, alcohol, not much else.

Taste: On the dry side. Not very complex, like a roasty version of a dry triple. 

Palate: Medium body. think texture. soft carbonation. exceptionally long finish.

Szinta leírhatatlan belga csoda ez is ! Már a színe és a habja is hozza a klasszis osztályt. Aztán jön az illat melyben szilvás, áfonyás, korianderes, mazsolás felhangok valamilyen fanyar, de fantasztikusan csábító szimfóniát lejtenek és még meg sem kóstoltuk ! Mikor mégis megtörténik, szinte abbahagyhatatlanul újra és újra kóstolná az ember, annyi íz csábítja egyszerre ! A jóleső fanyarság marad korianderrel, gyógynövényekkel, valami savanykás gyümölcsösséggel, némi karamellás, csokis pörköltséggel, meg még ki tudja milyen ízekkel együtt. Lélegzetelállító, ha csak ez az egy sör lenne a világon, az sem lenne akkora katasztrófa.

A brown ale that can be drank year round. Brown with hints of red in color large off white to tan head. Aroma is yeast and port wine or maybe rasian. May sound crazy but is fizzy and flat at the same time. Lite and refreshing not your average brown ale.

Deep brown/red. Fizzy, light brown head. Malt, raisin, alcohol and som vegetable aroma. Medium to light mouth feel, slightly low carbonation. Refreshing, but nothing special. Like a good, darker amber ale.
Dark brown color with medium fizz. Great balance of caramel and malt so it is not too sweet, and a smooth finish.

Nice black with off white foam head, lacing. Of course it was evening dark, so couldnt have much other color. Aroma is caramel dominated. Taste is not too sweet, some bitterness. Perfect beer for drinking while eating "Moule Frite". (Antwerp 201309)
The little fizzyness is very nice. Deep color and flavor, almost red berries, little banana and chalky. Mitra Mijdrecht.
Poured from a cold bottle. Dark brown caramel color, medium tan head. Sour malt aroma. Cinnamon, malt, caramel flavor.

Aroma: Caramel, sweet, and lightly negative.
Appearance: Dark brown, beige head that disappears quickly. 
Taste: Lightly bitter, dry. long but unpleasant aftertaste.
Bottle. Deep brown with a beige head. Aroma is chocolate with floral notes and spice. Dark rich flavor with lots of chocolate and malt. Very tasty and complex. An excellent dubbel.

A great dubbel. Pours a beautiful light inky black with a thin tan head. Smells like green apples and bananas. Taste is not super thick, but smooth, with lots of sour apple and some grapes. Finishes malty. Brought bottle back from Belgium. Good stuff!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A mighty fine Belgian dubbel. Subtle sweet in the Belgian way with roasted caramalt and some dark fruits. Nice.

Bottled. Dark brown with orange and a high, rocky head. Nose of caramel, raisin, spice. Spicy flavor, chocolate, caramel, dried fruits, cola, coriander. Decent bitterness and balance, though not that special.

Dark brown pour with an off-white head. The aroma is full of toffee and dark fruit. The flavor has some strong dark fruit notes as well as some toffee, caramel and alcohol. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
Nice amber pour. Medium head descent carbonation. Taste of a grape like wine. Very mild. Very good.

Pours a nice amber color with a thick fluffy tan head. Aromas of caramel and malt. Flavor has a nice bit of bite woth a mid taste of currants or grapes and a little caramel aftertaste. Quite a nice beer.

Big beige head, and brown colour. Smells brown sugar, nutty. Taste too, quite sweet with a bitter finish, but not too much.
Not bad, but average.
Bottle thanks to mora2000. .Nose is brown sugar, spice, sweet, caramel..Taste is caramel, spice, brown sugar, dark fruit,

Weak aromas but pleasant. Dark brown color. Smooth beer with good flavor.
Quite ok brown ale this

33cl. Pours dark amber with a big mostly lasting beige head. Powerfull aroma, sweet, malty, yeasty, caramel, and some notes of roasted/coffee all very well balanced. Flavour is fruity,sweet, caramel with a light bitterness, moderate carbonation
Try my hand at a galctic cat and a street wizard break dance competition. I vote for Brown abbey beer because its got moves.

Bottle. Dark reddish brown beer with medium head. Aroma of roasted malts. Taste is roasted malts, caramel and some sweet molasses. Medium carbonation light to medium bodied. OK, but was hoping for better.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Great name, may adopt it. More like a creamy Guinness, quite porterish, chocolate, yes.
Bottle from backlog. Pours dark brown - slightly muddy with off-white head. Nose and taste of caramel, sweet malt, bready malt and brown sugar. Medium body.

The aroma is chocolate, raisin, fruit, earthy, not as sweet as it sounds. The appearance is nice brown, off-white head. The flavor is sweet, raisin, fruit, very light pepper. The finish is sweet, than a light spicyness. Medium in body, slightly thick. Good.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2014 Bottle at home. Color is dark reddish brown and has a big, off white head. Aroma is malty and sweet and the taste is the same with a little bit of spice thrown in. The taste is excellent, this is a great dubbel.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2014 0,33l fles gedeeld met lexus, mooi donker bruin bier met een crèmekleurig schuim. In de geur kersen. In de smaak tikkje trekkend met een zuurtje. Leuke dubbel met bovengemiddelde body. 

Op proefavond biergilde hoorn ook een ca. 5 jaar oude 3l fles gedronken. Totaal ander verhaal bier is veel rijker qua geuren en smaken met rogge, port cacao en caramel tonen. Zeker een aanrader al ben je in de gelegenheid.

Lots of natural flavor here - dark fruit, bread and even iron. It does taste very unbalanced but theres still a really nice appeal in how organically rich the flavors are. That said, the overall texture and experience is light and bubbly enough to justify the emphasis on earthy tones. Paired with a nice cheese, this could go from good to great.

Pours a bottom-textured black with bubbly, off-white head. Light and refreshing for a dubbel, hints of bitter chocolate malts.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown, with nice head. Really nice nose and malty yet not too sweet body. Dubbels are not my favorite but this one is really nice.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Scurissimo color bruno con deboli riflessi rossi in controluce, solido cappello di schiuma beige chiaro. Aroma deboluccio con sentori di lievito, malto e frutta; gusto discretamente bilanciato tra dolce e amaro con delicate note fruttate, tostate e caramellate e un finale di liquirizia. Corpo medio, struttura acquosa, effervescenza debole; nulla di trascendentale.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours clear dark amber in color with a creamy off-white head. Bready malty, light nutty 

notes and a bit of sweet brown sugar in aroma. Bready malty, dark bread and light nutty notes in taste. 

Dark bready finish as well.

Bottle at home, courtesy of JRR :). 
Malty nose, sweet, sour, nice:)
Clear light amber color, white head. 
Medium to full body, sweet, caramel, hay. Small bubbles. 
Really nice ale. 



:)
Bolton Brew.

It poured a dark brown color with an off-white head. The aroma was of sweet caramel malts. The taste was lots of sweet bread, cereal, brown sugar and caramel malt notes. It had a good balance and carbonation. Well done.

750 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown with medium head that settles quickly. Aromas of vegetables, brown sugar,spice, and roasted malts. Flavors are very similar with additional spice and licorice. Lots of carbonation. OK, but Belgium has better to offer.
Прекрас& бельгий& эль. Немного невнятн& запах, иначе баллов было бы больше.О шоколад& вкус, очень легко пьется. Красива& стильна& бутылка.
Dark brown color with hefty foam production. Taste has hints of dark fruits, breads and yeast.

What a beauty! Doesnt look too extraordinary with those large bubbles, but it tastes like heaven. Aroma of sweet dates, very very sweet, plums and chocolate. Tastes the same, bit with more fruits, some of that cellar ageing for the fruits, sourness and little hoppiness noticeable. Medium bodied, it is perfectly crafted to hide the alcohol content. I had it a bit too warm, but it was fabulous.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Dark brown coloured brew with red glow fine bitter taste with hints of caramel and roasted malts.

Bottle. Dark brown, sediment. Wonderful dark malty, with belgian candi, dark marzipan, dark toffee on nose. Sweet dark malty. Body is medium full, dark malty, tasty. Nose was excellent, but body could be softer, fuller. But an excellent beer, good drinkability.-- bb/h(n9)

Good Belgian brown with All the right notes. Big malts with great richness this is a classic example of the brown for the guim! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sweet for an abbey dubbel but still great.Raisins is the foremost taste and aroma that comes to mind, hints of molasses, brown sugar, prunes. Pours reddish brown with oil slick head. Mouthfeel is also slick and finish is mildly dry. Truly enjoyable.
September 2010. From bottle. Poured dark brown with a tan head. Dark fruit aromas blended with spices. Good balance.

Corsendonk Pater Dubbel has a medium, cream colored head and a dark brown (ruby under light) appearance, with some light lacing left behind. The aroma is of spicy, sweet, bread, and the flavor is of peppery, spicy, sweet bread, coriander, a hint of banana, raisin, dark fruit, a touch of chocolate, and a mild bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy, and Corsendonk finishes semi-dry, sweet, and carbonated. Overall, this is another great Belgian ale, and I score it most excellent. RJT
130413. Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with a medium head. Aroma malts, brown sugar, caramel. Slightly sweet. Medium bodied. Not Bad.

Great appearance,  deep brown colour, Off-white and tiny head which quickly disappears. Spicy and caramel aromas, with nuances to some nuts. Yeasty flavour, well balanced though a little bit confuse. Watery texture, well carbonated, medium bodied. Strange overall, because of a metallic and soapy aftertaste that made me think that the beer was spoiled.   Need to have again.

Frothing head, gotta love those. Not sure if Ive had one from North America yet, for some reason. I cant believe this wasnt slightly aged in wine barrels, the nose is really something else, must just be the specific combination of hops, but its just beautiful, very floral, red wine, a whole lot of raisin. Taste is more raisin and dark malt... usually when I say dark fruit Im alluding to fig and dates but here its all about the raisin, more than any other beer Ive had. Lots of esters. Finish is nice and long. This is a great fing beer, best dubbel Ive had yet.
Draught at Leijuva Lahna, Helsinki. Colour is dark brown with brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Belgian yeast, dark fruits, raisins, sweetness and malts. Too carbonated for me.
Pours dark ruby/brown with a minimal off-white head. Aroma of cherry, ripe fruits, belgian yeast. Taste is some licorice, cherry again, some caramel

Bottle, 330 ml, at home. Poured into a tulip glass. ABV 7,5%
Very deep brown -almost black- colour on the body, with nice ruby shades. Two full fingers of tan to beige head. Good retention and nice rings of lacing left around the glass, as the foam goes down.
Aroma of roasted malts, not so strong. Some caramel alongside with dark fruits.
Slighty bitter taste, with light acidity, more obvious on the aftertaste. I expected it to be more complex, but I am getting just some caramel malts notes and nothing more. *Edit: As it warms up, more flavours are surfacing. Roasted malts, some chocolate too, red grapes.
Quite carbonated. Medium thin body.
Overall, not sp bad after it has warmed up a bit.

reddish-brown colour; huge foamy brownish head; less intensive aroma of berries and malts with some alcohol; excellent taste of brown sugar, malts ant fruity freshness with some spicy aftertaste; really good dubbel; its a pity that it has not too intensive aroma...

re-rate: as it became warmer and warmer the aroma turned more and more intensive; so in the end, it is a really great dubbel!

Head: thin beige foam. Colour: ruby red. Aroma: almost none. Taste: malt, yeast, some sour. Palate: refreshing, full, medium CO2, light bitter finish. Overall: nice.
One of the first Belgians I tried. Raisin brown sugar apricot caramel and cocoa showcased in noble hops. Yummy

750 ml bottle into chalice, best before 2/24/2015.  Pours crystal clear very dark reddish brown color wit ha 1-2 finger foamy light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers.  Spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with plenty of streaming carbonation retaining the head.  Aromas of big raisin, pear, apple, fig, brown sugar, molasses, toast, floral, pepper, light clove, and yeast earthiness.  Damn nice balance and complexity of dark malt and yeast ester notes.  Taste of raisin, pear, apple, date, brown sugar, molasses, caramel, light chocolate, toast, brown bread, pepper, light clove, floral, and earthy yeast spiciness.  Lingering notes of dark and light fruits, light chocolate, brown sugar, molasses, caramel, toast, brown bread, pepper, light clove, and earthy yeast spiciness on the finish for a good bit.  Fantastic balance and complexity of malty flavors with fruity/spicy esters; and zero cloying flavors present after the finish.  Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a fairly slick, earthy, and lightly prickly mouthfeel that is very nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a fantastic Belgian Dubbel style!  Great balance and complexity of malt and fruity.spicy ester flavors; and extremely smooth to sip on.  A highly enjoyable offering.
Decent aroma, appearance, taste and palate, overall memorable. Rated from the bottle.

11.2oz bottle, from Party Source. Dark brown, slightly red, near-black color. Huge foamy, light tan pillowy head. Dark fruit... Rich, more malty nose. Bigger body. Soft, more pronounced, though kind of smooth carbonation. Dark fruit, spice flavors. Sweet taste overall. A fine example of a Belgian dubbel. Light bit of chocolate. Fine, just not really my kind of brown.

Corked & Strapped 750 ml Bottle. Dark chestnut brown in appearance along with a cap of tan foam. Aroma is a mix of caramelized sugars, yeast, dark fruits and oak. The taste has notes of black cherry, raisin and dried fig upfront leading to brown sugar, dessert spice, cocoa and toffee. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied with strong carbonation and a dry, spiced finish. Interesting take on the style.
Quite surprisingly different than the usual.. dont remember much of it but it was very classy and worth.

Appearance: nice head, dark beer.
Nose: malts, raisins, hops
Taste: forest fruits, hints of chocolate
Not really my kind of beer

Hoppy Pilsen/Saaz/Hallertau aroma with spice, lemon, and yeast.  Tangy, fruity (especially raisins), spicy flavors predominate and blend wonderfully with each other.  Slight hoppy bitter aftertaste.  Their tripel is a standout to me, and so it was wonderful to try out their dubbel and find out that they are just a great Belgian brewery overall, not a one-note.  Highly recommended.
A very good dubbel.  Has all of the dark fruit, spicyness, and caramel flavors youd expect.  A roasted aroma with some alcohol.
330 ml bottle, rated from old tasting notes.  Aroma has malt, raisins, dried fruits and some yeast. Taste of choco malt, dark fruits with hints of raisins. Nice beer

Excelente Dubbel belga, essa breja é equilibradissima! Carbonataçao extrema, numa cor escura, com aroma típico de uma boa Dubbel: nozes, caramelo, café e frutas. Amargor interessante para uma Dubbel, tornando-a mais equilibrada do que a maioria. Corpo médio, também contribuindo para o equilíbrio da mesma, com retrogosto amargo/maltado no fim. Excelente cerveja!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle (2014 expiry) from mathieuc, thanks! pours hazy light brown with a nice light beige head, some retention and lacing. fruitiness, caramel, lot of spices - coriander, molasses and roasted caramel malts. hint of acidity and umami, relatively dry herbal-grassiness. average to soft carbonation, medium body, medium long bittering grassy finish.
UPDATED: MAR 9, 2013 Terrific dubbel. Pours dark red/copper color with a fluffy white head. Lots of roasted malt taste, very balanced. One of my favorite dubbels

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur brune et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées aux faibles notes sûres (raisins, léger de prunes et de cerises noires), malté de de caramel aux notes terreuses, légèrement épicé (clou de girofle, notes de poivre) avec des notes dalcool (notes vineuses) et très faiblement boisé (bois humide). Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-élevé et une texture légèrement vineuse et aux notes crémeuses. Goût de levures fruitées aux notes sûres et terreuses (raisins vineux, léger de prunes et de cerises) et légèrement épicées (léger de clou de girofle, notes de poivre) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un goût de caramel avec des traces de toffee rôti et conjointement à un léger-moyenne goût dalcool aux notes vineuses ainsi que de faibles notes de houblon herbeux. Post-goût long et aux notes sèches, léger-moyen amer dalcool avec un léger goût fruité (moût de raisins vineux, léger de cerises et de prunes).

Corsendonk Pater kaatuu panimon omaan tulppaaniin tumman colanvärisenä, vaahto on lähes valkoinen ja runsas. Haju on vahvasti mausteinen ja hieman hedelmäinen, dubbelmaiseen tapaan. Maku on mausteinen ja kuivatun hedelmäinen, etenkin persikkaa löytyy. Suutuntuma on ohut. Kokonaisuutena maistuva dubbel, jonka hyvin voisi lisätä Alkonkin valikoimiin, vaikkei ehkä ihan suosikkeihin nousekaan.

Bottle 33cl. Pours a white head with an element of brown. Big and foamy, nice bubbles. Medium body. Aroma has malt, raisins and yeasty sour fruit. Taste of choco malt and dark bread.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl bottle poured into a Chalice glass (Affligem glass)

aroma.......fruits, raisins. Not a strong smell but very very clear aroma of raisins
appearance.......dark beer with a big head (2 fingers) colour white-beige with some persistence
taste..........not too much sweety, very nice in mouth with notes of cocoa. Long aftertaste 
palate....... medium /full body and medium carbonation
overall.... very nice ale. Not enolic notes and without excess of sweet notes you have a very well balanced dubbel . Elegant and enjoyable.

#49
Tolles Dubbel mit reichlich Schaum! Im Aroma alles, was das Herz begehrt: Malz, Schokolade, Kaffee, Toffee, lecker! Vollmundiger Antrunk und die Geschmacksnuancen wiederholen das tolle Aroma nach Toffee und Kaffee im Abgang. Ein echter Bringer unter den Dubbel Bieren! 
	
Test vom 20.10.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 13,13,13,13,12,13 - 12,95

330 and 750ml bottle. Nice caramel and toffee aromas. Pours dark brown, cloudy, with some off-white head, long-lasting, some lacing. Medium body, average carbonation. Taste is sweet, fruity, raisins, caramel, with some hints of roast malt. Enjoyable and nice.

Red-brown with medium tan head.  Aroma brown sugary, very fruity although hard to say exactly what.  Overall medium body but perhaps a little lighter than you would expect.  Light carbonation.  No alcohol is noticable.  Flavor is fairly complex, sweet malt, dark fruits, some hops.  Very drinkable.  Great beer.

Bottle 0,33L. Dark amber reddish colour with fully lasting, stabile, light brown, creamy head. Very fruity aroma, mostly of apricot and peach. There are also some coriander notes in the background. Taste is mix of acidic and bitter and it doesnt convince me, I acctualy expected more.

Bottle. Pours clear very dark amber with plentiful, stable off-white head. Clear aroma of malt and hops. Pleasant, sweet and roasted flavour of malt, hops and caramel. Non-aggressive, dry aftertaste. Good stuff.

Clear brown with a large light beige head that fades to a good coat. Bready aroma with pears, raisins, caramel, chocolate, light spices. Rich but a lot less sweet than suggested by the aroma, also less yeasty. Lightish bodied, certainly for 7.5%. High carbonation. Dried fruit, chocolate, burnt sugar. The richness is fleeting as the finish is rather dry and peppery. Not that involving, but elegant.

750 mL bottle from Rouses Market in New Orleans, Louisiana, served in a high ball glass. Pours cloudy reddish brown with a small-moderate tan head. The head mostly remains and leaves a small amount of fine lace. On the nose, there are notes of raisins, caramel, fruit, yeast and hints of smoke and dark chocolate. The flavour is moderately sweet with lots of raisins, toasted malts, yeast and dark fruit. The finish is long with roasted malts, yeast, fruit and a touch of port. On the palate, it is medium in body with a dryish texture and average carbonation. Overall, this is a decent dubbel. The Belgian yeasty notes impart a nice complexity and the malts are very nice. I would have liked a more substantial body, however. 2012-04-26
Absolutely delicious pater dubbel beer. Exceptionally smooth and huge drinkability. If this was the only beer a bar had I would have no problem having it all night

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2013 Diepbruine kleur met oranje gloed, geen blijvende schuimkraag. Moutig en zoet (caramel) aroma. Fris zoet in de mond. Een milde, bittere nasmaak. Medium koolzuur, medium body. Prima dubbel.

750ml bottle. Clear dark brown color. Medium size brownish head. Sweet, raisins, peach, plums, yeast in aroma. Very bread, caramel, raisins, some roast in flavor. Crisp texture. Watery, ashy aftertaste.

12 oz bottle pours a very dark brown with 2 finger rocky tan head. Fairly lively and bubbly. Pretty to look at. Smell of sour tart apples. Taste is highly carbonated tart fruit. This is almost champagne like, but being much less pronounced with the fruit. Slight sourness on the end. Short finish that does not linger. Really enjoyable, different too.

Aroma: wheat, fruity, smells good

Appearance: extremely dark amber color, thick nice head golden in color

Taste: hint of dark roasted malt, caramel, slight hoppy aftertaste, 

Palate: smooth on the tongue, more on the dry side, minimal lingering aftertaste

Overall: delicious ale reminds me of chimay blue. Try again


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fruits, grapes, dark fruit, and mild roast aromas.  Brown with off white head, mild lacing.  Roast, dark fruit and full bodied.  Great balance and good carbonation.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 11.05.2011
Aroma has raisins, some orange peel, ripe fruits and some toffee typical to an aged Belgian ale. Flavour has raisins, orange peel, some toffee and hints of herbs. A bit stinging CO2 on palate. Aging has taken some of the sweetness away.

Pretty high carbonation for style. Aroma of roast malt and a little dark berry, but not much for a double. Almost a salty soda water vein going through this. No sweetness, which is surprising for a dubbel. Pours brown with foam and good lacing. Some boozy aroma as well.

From 4 year old 0.75L bottle. Nice dark, quickly dissapearing head. Sweet, fruity smell. Very well carbonated, not too much but just enough. Sweet taste, slighly bitter aftertaste. Aroma of  mostly caramel and yeast.
Earlier rated as the corsendonk pale ale.  weak aromas but pleasant. Dark brown color. Smooth beer with good flavor. Excellent carbonation. On tap at Witherspoon grill Princeton New Jersey.

Light brown frothy head that mostly lasts. Sparkling dark ruby red body. Aroma of caramel, malts, fruits, hops and alcohol. Taste is sweet and acidic, going to sweet, warming alcohol, slight bitter finish. Palate is medium, a bit sticky and a bit watery. A well balanced dubbel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

Bottle @ home. Pours hazy dark brown w/ off-white head. Fairly lively head, good lacing. Aroma is caramel, bready malt, some yeast. Flavor is much the same; pretty light, fairly low carbonation, slightly creamy mouthfeel, very easy to drink. Another great Belgian

Pours near black with a large frothy white head. Aroma is spicy at first followed by brown sugar, molasses, yeast, bread, malt, cocoa. Well hidden alcohol. Some liveliness in the mouth. Plummy, some raisin, not much bitterness and not too sweet either. Good balance.

11.2oz Bottle. The pour was a muddy dark brown with a nice reddish hue around the edges and an average (1-2 finger) tan creamy head that had great retention pretty much lasting throughout, thus creating some excellent sheets of sticky lacing.

The aroma starts with a roasted sweet bread malt and moves on with an earthy somewhat leathery yeast. In the back ground I sensed notes of milk chocolate, molasses, brown sugar, some dark fruit (raisons and figs), a hint of smoke and a mild winey alcohol presence.

The taste started with a nice malty sweetness and had hints of chocolate and brown sugar, progressing with a good bit of dark fruit and a slight alcohol finish. The flavor had a decent duration following the swallow with a sweet fruity taste fading as a mild creamy chocolate alcohol flavor settled on the taste buds.

Mouthfeel was a strong medium in body with an extremely smooth and creamy texture and an almost flat carbonation.

Overall this was an exquisite tasting brew, one that possessed a nice sweet malty taste with a really intense creamy feel. This hid the moderately high ABV extremely well and made a pleasure to consume...

Bottle 330ml. At Bateau de Nuit, served in Corsendonk glass.
Pours dark brown with reddish reflects. High beige head, good lacing. Aroma is of sweetnes, malt, caramel. Taste is of sweetness, caramel, malt, sligth spices?, some faint warming alcohol. Palate: Medium body. Overall: Pretty good. Easily drinkable. Not very bold, but no flaws either. Certainly lots of sugar in there, but not cloying.

0.75l bottle. Served in a trappist glass. Cork was very hard to get out. Appearance: Opaque black, lots of visible carbonation, sparse beige head. Aroma: GRAPES, wow. Other notes of cotton candy, caramel, grass. Palate: Thick bodied, but not like a stout. Very fizzy. Not much of a finish. Taste: Slightly sweet. Not as grape-y as the aroma suggests. No bitterness here at all. Fairly good be. Super easy to drink for this style.

Bottle (330 ml). Reddish brown with a medium long lasting beige head and nice lacing. Aroma of malt/caramel, belgian yeast and spices. Taste is sweet and about the same as aroma but lighter. Medium body. Good balance. Right on style. Very good Abbey Dubbel!
Nice white frothy head thats maintains for a good while. Sweet aroma. Lacking in body, soft drink like. Cant see that this meets criteria for a dubbel. Disappointing beer

Dark brown body crowned by an everlasting, creamy, light-brown head that sticks to the glass. The aroma isnt very strong at all, so I spend some time to lure out all the complex aromas: sweet dark dried fruits, raisins, plum (actually a bit plum in madeira), sugar, some yeast and even some faint hoppy notes. The taste is moderate to light sweet with a very light bitter finish that unfortunately is a bit short. The flavours are as humble as the aroma, but again quite complex and very nice. There is the regular malty backbone with dark dried fruits, but addition to this there is a refreshing and crisp citric part with additional fresh fruits. Medium body with a surprisingly watery texture for the style, although it also has a certain creamy feel. The finish also has a very light dryness. A very nice dubbel that isnt too sweet, and the citrus makes all the difference.
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 2 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online

Brown with a red hue it carries a self propelling head that leaves some lacing. It smells mostly of malt with a hint of spice. Creamy with an ample mouth. Overall a really enjoyable dubbel that is easily forgotten though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl. bottle poured in to a tulip. Dark brown colour with a big, creamy off-white head. Reddish hues. Sweet and fruity aroma with rich malts, candid sugar, citrus and dark, dried fruits. Very good. Taste is light sweet. Medium body with a creamy texture. Lively carbonated. Finishes with orange peel, citrus, dark dried fruits and a good amount of dark malts. Discrete bitterness. Well made dubbel.

Bottle consumed at Punta Birra Viareggio. Dark brown pour off white head. Sweet caramel malt aromas. Lots of sweet bread, cereal, brown sugar, and caramel malt notes. Good balance and carbonation.  A nice example of the style.

A very clean and simple Belgian brown ale.  Old world quality.  Unpretentious yet remarkably well-made.  Notes of chocolate malt and light-browniness.  Earthy and bready and smooth, and almost light.   Elegant and classy Brussels lace engages the side of the glass throughout the drinking. Goes great with a raspberry ale-infused parmesan cheese.  This brew is wonderful.
Fra flaske på Den tatoverede enke: en god brun uten spsiell sødme, lettdrikkelig. Fruktig anslag, men en noe metallisk bitterhet i avslutningen.
Chocolate. Molasses. What on earth are molasses. Whatever they are Im getting them. You gotta love a good Belgian yeast right? Seems to me that Summer Wine use plenty of it. Carl?
Bottle at Klub malych pivovaru, Plzen. Pours dark red to black color with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma is spices, licorice, caramel. Taste is spices, malt, fruits, chewing gum.

pours dark cola brown with a nice creamy foamy head, good retention and lacing, lots of active CO streams. Mainly malts on the nose. Drinks with a very creamy bright almost cola-like start, medium sweetness (5/10), transitions into malts, bread, hints of root beer, finishing mildly sweet and light clean bitter. Medium complexity, medium depth, great transitions, good carry, excellent drinkability. A beer that drinks like a COLA/ROOT BEER!

[Bottle from Beers of Europe that Jim shared with me - cheers!] Mahogany with a large, off-white head. Deep fruity (plums?) flavour from the off. A bit of gravy, some chocolate and brown bread, yeast, molasses  and banana all peeked out at times, but overall it was a little on the sweet side. The alcohol is quite evident too.
Aroma van kersen, hout, licht koffie en karamel. Smaak is een verlengde met pruimen, met genoeg bubbels. Koud ingeschonken, kraag blijft niet overeind, maar wel bestaan.

750ml bottle. Pours brown mahogany color with a quick tight soapy off white head that fades to a nice collar. Aroma is nutty robust malt and dark fruit like plum and raisins. Taste is slightly bitter and has some chocolate notes with the malt and then the raisin and plum flavors show through. Palate is a little less than medium and finishes fizzy and dry. Very good beer!
Dark amber brown with modest head. Caramel malt with toffee and spice notes. Not too heavy.
Dark brown body, light brown head. Nice noble hop aroma, yeast, cola, chocolate. Very nice dubbel with clear flavours, bit thinnish though.

Aromas ligeros para ser una cerveza de abadía madurada con un año de guarda
Principalmente notas a maltas tostadas, caramelo y chocolate.

En cuanto a la apariencia, simplemente perfección, la cual se espera se traduza también al paladar.
Color obscuro intenso con reminiscencias rojas a la luz. Carbonatación ligera, prácticamente nula. Cuerpo redondo y corona de espuma abundante y de larga retención. 

En boca, suave y cremosa, sin reflejar su contenido alcohólico.

Al paladar, ligero amargor que da la sensación de una cerveza seca en un principio. Destacan los sabores a maltas tostadas y el caramelo dota al liquido de un final medio,  ligeramente dulce, achocolatado y cremoso.

En terminos generales una cerveza de abadía diferente. Que sorprende y asusta en un principio, y conforme avanzan los tragos envuelve y convence. Cremosa, para degustar tranquilamente.

Bottled, 0.33l. Clear dark brown color with medium frothy  brownish head that was quickly gone. Visible carbonation is lively. Aroma of floral hops, yeast and caramel malt. Taste starts with sour orange and is followed by sweet caramel. Earthy and alcohol note are present, too, otherwise feels very warm and mouth-coating, while moderate hoppiness is felt in the background. Full body, thick texture and lively carbonation. Sweet Belgian specialty...

Caramel, toffee, and some spice in the aroma.  Taste starts sweet with caramel, brown sugar, some fruit, and a little hop bitterness.  Finish has spice, some fruit, and a little alcohol.  A great Belgian dubbel.

Picked this up for $5 at a local beer store. Enjoyed in a Chimay glass

A - Poured a light brown out of the bottle. In the glass, dark brown with some amber edges. 2 finger tan head with a mix of big and small bubbles that fades rather slowly

S - Smells like caramel candies with sugar.

T - Taste is similar but, of course a lot more going on. Caramel, brown sugar, honey and spices. Some oranges and dark fruits like figs and raisins Slight metallic taste.

M - 100% carbonation on the mouth swish. Medium body. very drinkable

O - This is very nice! Very enjoyable and easily available Dubbel.

Tap@ Brasserie Henri, Budapest 23.6.2012. Poured dark brown, thick creamy head. Sweet fruity, caramel and yeast in aroma. Flavor has sugar coffee, dark fruits, caramel with herbal notes kicking in later. Long, smooth finish. Great drinkability. Even if quite sweet, liked it a lot.

Bottle, 0,33 l.
Reddish brown with lasting off-white to light brown head.
Very nice aroma. Caramel and wet hay with hints of dark fruits. 
Balanced taste on the sweet side, with some sourness in there somewhere. Pleasant bitterness in the finish.
(tap) medium brown with generous tan head. Aroma of yeast, slightly fruity malt. Flavor is slightly sweet, dark fruits, some yest.
The best beer that I have tasted so far. Full of flavours and great aroma. A beer just for me

Bottle. Eggshell head, darker muddy brown hue. Sweet malty aromas, with some slight fig, toffee, dark fruits and some candy.  Flavor isnt as sweet as suggested in the aroma, but has solid toffee, maltiness, and almost a touch of a savory character.   Medium slick body.

Bottle at Strijdershuis in Brugge. 
This ones got kind of a special place in my heart, and I had committed myself to drinking one while I was in Belgium. Years ago I purchased a 750ml of this stuff for a friend. I remember it was a morning when we opened the bottle in the dorms, this was the first Belgian beer I had ever drank. The flavor was so unique from anything I had tried before, I was hooked from that moment. 

The beer pours a deep brown with a huge slightly loose head that leaves a lot of lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is nutty & even a little corny. The beer is very rich smelling, plenty malty with some bright fruit and spice notes.

The flavor is a nice mix of raisin, spice, and pear with some mild warming alcohol, the beer is moderately sweet, plenty malty, and lightly nutty.

Very enjoyable, but perhaps not as exciting as my first go at it.

Dark red colour, coca cola like, fizzy, reddish foam. Pleasant sweet smell, mild sour smell. Fizzy feeling on tongue, leaves sour taste afterwards. Good mild sweet sour taste. Very good beer, I like sweet sour combination.
Slightly frothy dark beer, best if drunk very cold. Toastycaramel, leaves, woody, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, lively, overall great experience from a beer.
Pitch black coloured, and extremely smooth inside the mouth, the taste keeps a while, and you definitely enjoy after all.

Bottle at Eulogy. Dark orange brown pour with a foamy off-white head. No lacing but a fair amount of foam lingered in the middle. Dark malt flavors but some herbs and spices jumped out first. Vegemite. Cardamon. Nutmeg. Sage. Black tea. More red fruit as it warms. Prunes. Raisins. Dates. Spice balances the dark sweetness from the malt. Medium body. Goes some different places than the average Belgium Dubbel.

Total Wine, Fairfax 11.2oz ($4.50): Pours a nice brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is winy, somewhat malty, with a good helping of Belgian yeast. Sometimes a Belgian ale has exactly the right yeast character. This was one of them. Anyway, this was nice and malty with good vinous notes throughout. Not too sweet like some dubbels, so that was a plus. Great body and perhaps far too easy to drink. In any case, I quite liked this, even though it was rather simple in comparison to some more complex examples of this style.
Nice dark brown beer with a nice foamy head. Subtle aroma. Drinks easily. Long lasting taste.
Fantastica birra belga dal sapore forte e consistente. Molto densa e cremosa. Un must per chi ama le birre belghe
Sampled at Ginger Man in NYC about a month back and didnt take proper notes, but just a really well balanced, delicious beer.

Dark brown with a fluffy off white head. The nose shows some light raisin bread and spice. Silky smooth mouthfeel which really shows off a delicate, elegant version of a Dubbel. Layered spiced orange and apples cascade over the palate. Long, complex finish.

33 cl. bottle @ one of the bars of the Metropolis cinema complex // dark brown with a well lacing, off-coloured tanned head // taste is yeast heavy, some excess here, overripe, touch synthetic / plastic dark fruits, dark bread grains, substantially present, herbal, definitely more herbal than spices, touch medicinal, fake aftertaste, which is too spritzy, too carbonated, body feels touch fake as well // acceptable but quite fake & synthetic tasting // Corsendonk seems to make one good, going to great beer, Agnus (might be less fan of it these days if I retry it), rest so far seems ignore, one of many ok, standard, ignorable Belgian offerings

Quality stuff but disappointing for my palate. Aroma and flavor just seemed burnt without anything else discernible going on. Rusty aftertaste. Greatly prefer other doubles like grimbergen or westmalle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep hazy red brown color with nice creamy tan head. Fruit notes are at beginning then belgian yeast flavour and at end sweet with brown sugar and caramel.
Its medium bodied beer. You must try this.

Poured this beer from the bottle into a 4oz sampling glass.  The beer had a dark brown-copper color with a dark amber hue, and off-white creamy head with average retention, good cling, and good lacing.  Its aroma featured sweet fruity raisin and plum tones with a touch of molasses, and bits of earthy and pine hops, along with some yeast and chocolate.  Its taste had a fruity, raisin sweetness at the start, that gradually faded into an earthy bitterness.  The beer was somewhat thin with a light body and feel, was dry, and had lower carbonation and life.  Thank you to Eric and Siobhan for the tasting.

Nice adark bronw color, with extra carbonation and small head. Delicious flavors with  The taste is lovely  with sweet apple, a little cloying,  liquorice mouthful finishing with some fruitcake and dry spices.  Body is thicker.

April 2008: from BA. 0.33L Bottle, drank 4 months after its Best Before date.

Poured into one of my Corsendonk stemmed glasses it looked great. Deep ruby red, clear but thick looking too. A huge light biege coloured head sat on top, lovely.

Yeast and malted barley really hit your nose, a good smelling Dubbel.

Strong malty taste with a treacle sweetness which isnt over the top. Not sickly sweet, but almost.

The sweetness dominates everything else, but it enjoyed the experience and have done many times before. Not the best Dubbel by any means, but not the worst either.

Pours dark brown with thick tan head. Aroma is somewhat lacking it seems - something vaguely gassy... maybe some sour fruit lingering in there somewhere... not much to report on. The taste is lovely however: starts sweet, a little cloying, before developing into a thick roasted apple and liquorice mouthful finishing with some fruitcake and dry spices. The body is a little sticky, which isnt great, and perhaps a little too carbonated too, but the taste is lovely enough to make up for this.

330ml bottle, poured into Leffe chalice. Very ddark ruby colour, thick, two finger thin tanned head which disappeared fast. Malty, citrus, hoppy vanilla smell. Tasted a balanced sweetness, malty with notes of orange and the liquer Quarenta y Tres (43). Mouthfull smooth but well carbonated. Very good, potentially dangerous as the booze is so well hidden.

Very dark brown, big tan head. Nose is sweet and malty, with fruity-citric notes. Taste is malty, with more citrus and strong caramel, plus some slight spice. Finish is malty, sweet, with dried fruits, spice, yeast. Smooth and gentle mouthfeel. Very nice balance.

Bottle by 06/09/14.  Lightly malty nose but a lot of fruit, some yeast, and abundant lemon floor cleaner.  Super abundant.  Body is a dark, dark ruby with a large rocky tan head.  Slick malt taste, body is thin and very sweet, raisins, light roast, deft smoke.  Yeast and the orange peel and lemon cleaner as above, but softer.  Port wine comparison is apt, and theres even a nibble of hops behind all the silken sheen and slow-burn chocolate.

From the 33 cl bottle marked 06/09/14. The pour is mahogany red with a tremendous, foamy head.  Aromas of yeast, dark malts, plum, and a touch of hop bitterness.  The body is roundabout medium.  The taste brings out a sharp bitter quality with a subtle smoky character. A fine Dubbel.

Une bière de réputation brassée par la brasserie du Bocq à Purnode
pour labbaye de Corsendonk à Oud Turnhout.
Une très jolie bouteille gravée au médaillon de Marie de Corsendonk,
de forme oblongue, et des caractères très jolis de style gothique.
Décor idéal donc pour préparer la dégustation dune abbaye double.
Cette bière dun niveau de 7,5 abv présente une très jolie couleur brun
sombre, est dune grande clarté et présente un pétillant vif, malgré un
âge dépassant de 10 mois la date limite pour mon exemplaire.
La mousse est beige, à flocons moyens et tiens correctement au début
de dégustation.
Les arômes sont dépices particulières, avec une pointe de poivre fin,
du terreau et du bois mouillé.
Le volume est liquide à consistant.
Le premier goût laisse poindre une pointe damertume, avec un goût de
terre, de prune, un côté charbon de bois du style Guinness, et un arrière-
goût de café et moka.
La seconde bouche est de café, de chocolat noir, de fèves et de haricots
tarbais.
La 3ème fait arriver le houblon et le malt.
La longueur est toute en équilibre et rondeur, avec malgré tout du caractère. La levure est bien structurée et très harmonieuse.
Lalcool est de belle proportion.
La finale est pleine et entière. 
Une très belle abbaye double, brassée par une brasserie traditionnelle
dune région rurale de Wallonie pour une abbaye de la région flamande à la limite des Pays Bas....

Subtle yet complex aroma of grassy hops, yeast, caramel and spice. Tall rocky tan head with large bubbles. Color is a crimson tinted mahogany. Appears mostly clear with a medium texture. Flavor has light sweetness, medium bitterness, a little sour. No specific esters overpower the others, very well balanced. Palate feel is of medium to full body. Slightly thick and creamy. Lively carbonation with a lingering mild finish. A very well balanced beer with lots of interesting subtleties.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2012 aroma: caramel, chocolate, toast, 
apparenza: brown, cloudy, 
gusto: medium sweetness, 
palato: medium body, soft carbonation, creamy, long finish, 
laroma sprigiona ottime note di malto tostato,in bocca il sapore predominante è proprio il dolce del caramello,amaro quasi assente e frizzantezza gradevole
bevuta a sasso di castalda
33 cl. bottle @ home. Mhonagy colour with a huge off-white head. Aroma of yeast, caramel and black fruits. Fulle bodied beer with a bitter aftertaste. Quite enjoyable.
A dark beer, notes of port,raisins and black chocolate and yeasty,fruit and slighty smokey bouquet.
Like a lot of Belgians, this one is awfully sweet. Great floral note and dark and heady like a beast, I was a bit disappointed...
Delicous floral sweet malted barley aroma.  Deep reddish brown in color.  Carbonation typically high in the belgen style, dancing on your tounge. Hints of nutmeg and cloves.

Brown pour with a big, sizzling head.  The aroma is mostly yeast with some fresh grass.  This is a pretty bready, malty dubbel, with some chocolate and pumpernickel in the mix.  It is not too sweet, and is well-balanced and drinkable.  It could be a nice session brew if not for the price tag.

Dark brown with fine-bubble, foamy tan head / Mild earthy, chocolate nose / Medium body, fine carbonation although mostly soft mouthfeel, with good balance and finish / Very mellow flavors of chocolate, raisin, and bread / Understated but very enjoyable and easy drinking.
A good brew. Nice dark / dried fruit aroma. Some sugar and bread taste with a chocolate and raisin finish. Well done.
Goes down great, fruity taste, hits the spot. dark appearance, medium foam, great beer

2012.03.15 - 750ml bottle in goblet. Pours a deep brown, light reveals some red.   An active light tan head lingers, and settles to a foamy cap.  Aroma is light bread, yeasty.   Taste is very nice. Malty sweetness in a very good balance with a bitterness.  Good carbonation.  Alcohol is basically undetectable and it goes down very smoothly.
Bottle. Deep brown color. Huge fluffy white head that fades. Taste is carmel and malty with nuts and booze, like a port. Very drinkable and delicious

330ml bottle from Bierzwerg
BBE 22/06/14 - Pours dark brown with a medium light brown head. Aroma of yeast, caramel malts, syrup, metallic notes and hints of ash and fruits. Taste is slightly sweet with fruity and spicy notes, hints of raisin, ash and chocolate. Finish is sweet and fruity with some malty notes. Okay, quite well balanced and fruity dubbel.

11.2 oz bottle.  Dark brown with a smooth tannish head.  Nose is raisin, brown sugar, zwieback and nutmeg.  Creamy with a sharp tang finishing dry and papery.  Taste is raisin, fig and plum then slightly sour with crabapple.  Its a good dubbel but not worth revisiting considering the cost.
brown, hazy, minimal head, caramel, nuts, roasty, alcohol, medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, average carbonation,
brown, hazy, tan foam, caramel, roasty, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness,

Pours hazy brown-amber color with a huge light brown head that sticks to the glass. Fruity sweet and spicy aromas, sugary plum and grape flavors, medium bodied with a crisp mouthfeel, finishes dry and clean.
A crisp, semi malty well balanced beer. Actually a little less malty the most doubles One of the more drinkable beers Ive had in a while
Probably a really good beer, but definitvely too strong for me. Not a great memory

Expected little and was surprised again!  Really super over-carbonated but still good.  Taste is nutty, light chocolate, medium sweetness, and a nice simple "goodness" that makes you want to keep drinking.  Great work.
Sweet candy apple aroma. Rich malts and that delicious Belgian yeast. This is simply amazing, great job!

chocolate, grass, cheese, vanilla, rotten eggs, butterscotch, ginger, clove, orange, cloudy, brown, brown foam, rocky head, rocky head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, long finish,

Dark reddish brown coloured beer with a beige head. The aroma is dark dried fruity, plummy, roasted malty. The taste is more sour than sweet, with notes of lime,yeast and roasted malt, chocolate, too. The aftertaste is bitter, but not so much. Its a good beer.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2012 Bottled-solid head,not an exceptional aroma,touch of lightly scented dish soap,cookie dough,smooth silky texture,bit of nutmeg,oatmeal raisin cookies,touch of clove,hint of rust,extraordinarily tasty beer,very layered taste,i really enjoyed this one

(bottle).   Deep brown complexion   Nutty, roasted Belgian malt flavor.  Perfect palate with warming alcohol. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown pour good head block size biege colour aromas raisin plum port candy yeast strong vanilla flavours sharp bright raisin port plum prune caramel vanilla brown sugar good taste finish sweet tasting smooth bright tastes dark fruit alcohol yeast good for the palate

Bottle 75cl - best before date 4/04/2010 - tasted 8/01/2012.
Pours deep red/brown.White head. Nose of raisins, plums, rumtopf - clear ageing influences. Taste is complex yet quite light and easy drinkable.

750mL bottle, pours a deep dark brown with a reddish tinge and substantial beige head. Aroma of brown sugar, candied sugar, toffee, dark fruits and some spiced nuts. Flavour of cola, candied sugar, toffee and toasted bread. Palate is quite thin, with a quickly-dissipating flavour profile. Lacking depth and overrated, Id say.

Bottle @ Home. Pours very dark brown with a creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malt, belgian yeast, sweet dark ripe fruit, licorice, spices. Taste is malt, plums, raisins, vanilla and spices. Thin to medium body, average carbonation. 010112
Bottle. Dark brown colour with large creamy off_white mostly lasting head. Aroma is soap and hops. Sweet flavor. Creamy palate.
Bière assez amère. Très foncé. Elle sapprécie sur la longueur. Le démarrage est assez dur à cause de la forte amertume et le goût dalcool.

Bottle over Christmas; dark ruby to brown with medium beige head; aroma-caramel, sweet, clove, alcohol, roasty, dark fruit, raisins; taste-medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, thin feel, fizzy. Quite long lasting and annoying effervescence. Almost perfect and complex aroma.

Deep brown appearance with nice lasting creamy head. Taste is nice mix of raisins, little port, caramel. Medium bodied, with slightly dry aftertaste. Smooth carbonation. Might well be my favorite abbey dubbel.

yeasty and highly effervescent like an alka-seltzer sweet and right on the nose. vegetable like flavor it is sweet and fruity. Pure cane sugar sweetness and deep caramel brown with a syrup mouthfeel. Somewhat mellow with some vanilla and currant on the malt with a hint of soy and brown gravy. Bright and cheery with a burp like 7 up. This beer doesnt bowl you over but in its components it is quite solid indeed.

33 cl bottle.BBE 07.02.2012.
Originally rated on 20100224. (7+4+8+4+15).
Pours dark ruby red colour with medium, long lasting head. Aroma of belgian yeast, ripe fruits, mild spicy notes, caramel malts and mild liquorice notes. Flavour of spices, caramel malts, belgian yeast, lots of ripe fruits and plum, mild oak notes and distant chocolate. Complex but very balanced brew with nice spicy finish.
5336

750 ml bottle with a best before date of 04/2010.
Aroma: fruity, plums, raisins,  grapes
Appearance: deep brown with tan head, head quickly diminished
Taste: similar fruity notes as in the nose, slight yeasty taste, coffee, chocolate, butter
Palate: medium bodied, finish towards the dry side
Overall: A great beer that still could age.
Refrigerated bottle at BXL poured into a tulip.  Pours translucent brown with fuffly tan head.  Pretty good lacing, slightly spicy yeast, and a hint of hops in the finish.  Expected a little more.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2012 Bottle. Dark brown colour with a big off white head. Ligth sweet nose. Light fruity and sweet flavour with some bitterness. Mild and easy drinking beer for a 7,5%

Original rating : april 2005 
Head: white, thick 
Colour: dark brown 
Smell: malts, a bit soury, fruits, sweet 
Taste: drief fruits, figs, malts, candy sugar, a bit of sourness in the end , end is sweet/dry , after is bitter , good !

AROMA: dark fruits, hint of chocolate, earthy, dough
APPEARANCE: reddish brown, forthy head, clear
TASTE: light sweetness, light bitterness, lightly sour
PALATE: medium body, oily feel, lively, mild bitter aftertaste
OVERALL: great abbey beer with an interesting balance of fruit to earthy notes and pleasant bitterness.

First iPhone rating. Bottle from 33. Pours dark mahogany brown with a medium beige head. Aroma of dusty Belgian yeast, musty basement, earth and dark fruits. Nice flavor of chocolate malts, dark and dried fruits, earth, basement, and candi sugar. Medium body with modest carbonation and a smooth, sweet mouthfeel. Excellent.

Old bottle (best before 10/09/11). Dark brown colour with a great head that last a long time. Malty aroma with some citrus in the background. Malty taste, some bread and some sweet aftertaste. Some mild spice in the taste. Not very special but a good beer. Will probably re-rate when a get a fresher bottle.

330 ml bottle. From bierzwerg.de.
Dark brown colour with average size tan head.
Mild aroma with dark fruits, some sugary sweetness and mild spices. 
Flavour is dark fruity with some mild bitterness. Quite cola-like. Very drinkable but also easy for a Dubbel. Warms nicely. Theres no much difference in aroma/taste whether its fridge cold or room temperature.

BIt of an older bottle best by 06/09. POurs medium brown color, nothing great. Some darker malts roasty even a little metalic, but not offensive. Flavors are a little more earthy, but seems right for an older brown. Not bad, will try a fresher bottle and re-review.

Nice deep brown color, generous, rocky light brown head, that dissipates rather quickly, but the lace clings mightly to the glass. The nose is dough,  fruity, plums, basement. Front sweet, malty, the middle is light to medium, big, bubbly carbonation, the finish is slightly sour, quite acidic, alcohol tones evident, and a light touch of hops in this dry finishing beer.

Draft sample at the 2011 Fall NOVA Beerfest, 10/22/11. Pours a clear copper-brown color with a thin creamy tan head. Fair head retention. Aroma of cherries, nuts, tart and sweet malts. The taste is sweet and tart malts with notes of spice, nuts, berries and tea. Thin bodied. High carbonation.

Tasted on 10/11/11 from a 330mL bottle, best before 02/02/14.  Pours opaque dark brown with a very faint red tint, and a massive, rocky tan head that slowly recedes to rocky lace.  The nose is yeasty with dough and dusty basement, along with some red berry fruits, and hints of smokey chocolate and coffee.  The flavor is somewhat austere, with flavors of cola, brown sugar, all very dry up front, and then a nice hint of sweetness on the back of the palate.  The body is light, with very lively carbonation, and a medium lightly sweet finish.

(bottled)Im not that much of a Dubble enthusiast ,they;re pretty mundane most of the time ..this isnt bad though#; dark fruit ,caramel richness and lively floral hop backdrop thats a refreshing quality...tobaco ,bitter dark chocolate ..roasty bitterness .
Bottle. Cloudy brown color. Sweet malts on the nose. Some sugary notes as well.  Cherry flavor, bubble gum and candy. Nice.

Bottle 0.33l. A dark brown colour with a high beige head (good lacing). An aroma of malt, yeast, fruit and caramel. The taste is sweet and light bitter. A medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation and a long light bitter finish. This is a really nice beer.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours deep brown, almost black with a big creamy tanned head. Aroma of dark fruits, brown sugar and spice. Taste is smooth, neither bitter nor sweet, just a very balanced brew, with fine notes of dark malts, light fruity. High carbonated. Yeasts and peppers towards the end.

Bottle at the local.  Thanks for sharing, guys.  Notes of dark fruits, yeast, spice. Flavor is a little watery, more yeast, dark fruits.  Pretty good dubbel, but the flavor doesnt match up to the nose.

Dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, toffee, & dark fruit; Flavor of slight roasted malt, yeast, caramel, dark fruit, and chocolate; Nicely balanced & complex; Overall, really good dubbel.

Bottle. Dark brown, average and mostly lasting light brown head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, caramel, light fruitiness and herbal spiciness. Body is medium, malty and sweetish flavor, light fruitiness and caramel, faint herbal spiciness. Finish is short to average, malty and lightly sweetish, faint caramel and spiciness. Flawless and boring.
Bottle at Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Nothing really special about this beer, just a decent useful Abbey Dubbel. Decent smell and taste, nice dark brown / dark amber color and a good strong mouthfeel.

pours a dark copper, clear with good looking dense tan head.  Yeasty, caramel malt nose.   Crisp snappy hop bite, caramel malt sweetness, hint of fruit (plum/raisin).   Finishes nice and clean.  Not too sweet, not too heavy.  Not too bitter or alcoholic.  Very easy drinking with well balanced flavor.  Havent had this in a long time and its better than I remember it.

33cl bottle. Pours a chestnut brown with a red hue.There is a perfect lacy head.  
The nose has apples and toffee. The taste has coffee, cream, toffee and nuts. 
The palate has a medium to large structure, is very creamy and it falls away very nicely at the end. Overall, a great beer of balance and elegance.

330mL bottle poured brown with creamy off-white head and nice lacing.  Aromas of caramel and chocolate with some yeast.  Tastes slightly sweet and smokey with a mild hop bitterness.  Moderate carbonation and medium body with decent mouthfeel.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2012 Updated my rating: Brown bodied with tan, medium, light tan head. Brown sugar, sandy, plum, cheese, cherry, tabacco. Mellow and dusty. Tastes about equally dry and raw, mostly light bitterness and with a bit too watery body. Still provides enough flavour though. Originally I was disappointed but I liked it much better this time around. Bottle was a US one it seems, at 7%. (75cl bottle, rerate of a 33cl bottle)
4/5 i mörkhet. Luktar väldigt maltigt. Fyllig, lätt rökig och väldigt maltig i smaken med en rund och fin maltig eftersmak.
Bottle at the Eetcafe in Antwerp. Black with a foamy head, smells nicely of hops. Lovely dark and creamy caramel beer.

33cl Bottle from Bierzwerg.  Appearance is hazy brown color with light, fizzy head that gives superb lacing.  Aroma is a huge bouquet of dried fruit, Belgian yeast, caramel, and spice.  Taste is forward on the fruit especially pear and apricot with the distinctive yeast notes, and some hints of toffee and smoke.  Not much bitterness to speak of.  Palate is smooth, medium-bodied, firm texture, soft carbonation, and a mild finish.  This is one of the best Dubbels out there.

750 ml bottled shared with friends and poured into a tulip glass.  The beer is medium brown in color with a foamy light tan head despite a gentle pour.  The beer is very effervescent with a medium body.  Notes of toffee, and some dried fruits like apricot and raisin.  Nice clean finish with a bit of roastiness on the palate.  Overall, a nice Dubbel.
Bottle. Pours a medium brown with a very thin head. Some rasins, caramel and wheat in the aroma. Medium body. Flavor also has the raisins, caramel and wheat, and some smokiness.
bread, toast, golden, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,
This one is a bit too sweet / caramel / candysweets like for me. Other than that its a decent dubbel but not my favorite.

Lovely deep russet to coppery brown with a voluminous creamy coloured head. As soon as the bottle opened I got a yeasty hit and then on closer inspection theres orange water, dark chocolate, vinous aromas. Theres a definite cinnamon spiciness along with freshness.
Smooth, silky caramel and chocolate. Beautiful brown ale nuttiness and subtle mouthfeel. Tasty and full flavoured. Very likeable.
